runners.name: Galician Girl
runners.comment: Raced far too freely on hurdling debut at Kilbeggan and well beaten; best watched for now
runners.spotlight: AW Flat winner is rated 63 in that sphere; raced far too freely on hurdling debut at Kilbeggan and well beaten; best watched for now.

runners.name: Annarubyrose
runners.comment: Beaten 25l in a Cork bumper on recent debut and needs to do much better on hurdling debut
runners.spotlight: Beaten 25l in a Cork bumper on recent debut and needs to do much better on hurdling bow.

runners.name: Atlantic City
runners.comment: Third at Limerick last time after a bad mistake; cheekpieces retained and can go closer
runners.spotlight: Showed some ability in two Flat starts last year; the best of three maiden hurdle runs when third at Limerick last time, just behind Janes Harbour, a bad mistake costing her; the cheekpieces worn then are retained and can go closer today if error-free.

runners.name: Bhean Saibhre
runners.comment: Runner-up in a handicap hurdle on heavy but was below that form on better ground since
runners.spotlight: Modest Flat maiden was runner-up in a Clonmel handicap hurdle on heavy ground but was below that form on better ground at Fairyhouse since; has a bit to find even at best.

runners.name: Georginas Jet
runners.comment: Beaten 27l in a Cork bumper on recent debut and will need to show significant improvement
runners.spotlight: Beaten 27l in a Cork bumper on recent debut and will need to show significant improvement for hurdling bow.

runners.name: Jaadil
runners.comment: Modest Flat maiden has been well held in two maiden hurdles and handicaps will suit better
runners.spotlight: Modest Flat maiden has been well held in two maiden hurdles and handicaps will suit better in time.

runners.name: Janes Harbour
runners.comment: Has run well in defeat several times in maiden and handicap hurdles; looks the one to beat
runners.spotlight: Showed some ability on sole Flat start; has run well in defeat several times in maiden and handicap hurdles; just ahead of Atlantic City at Limerick and nearest at the finish at Punchestown last time; looks a big player.

runners.name: Kick On Nellie
runners.comment: Beaten a long way in two maiden hurdles lately and needs to find significant improvement
runners.spotlight: Beaten a long way in two maiden hurdles lately and needs to find significant improvement.

runners.name: No More Silver
runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage Des Loges & M Francis Dunn
runners.comment: Well-bred filly is in good hands and the market can reveal what is expected on debut
runners.spotlight: One of two runners for yard; dam unraced sister to winners Tommy Silver (smart 2m-3m hurdle/chase) and Cross In Hand (French 2m2f Listed hurdle), half-sister to top-class 2m chaser El Fabiolo; well-bred filly was unsold for 30,000euros as a 2yo; in good hands and the market can reveal what is expected on debut.

runners.name: Queen Of The Kings
runners.comment: Pulled-up on sole point start but from a smart family so isn't dismissed; market can help
runners.spotlight: Pulled-up on sole point start but this 2,000euros 3yo is from the family of the classy Cooldine and hails from a respected yard so isn't dismissed; the market can help; tongue-tie.

runners.name: Radar Ahead
runners.comment: Below form on Flat here last time; showed ability on the first of two hurdle runs
runners.spotlight: Placed in several Flat maidens and is rated 74 in that sphere but was below form here last time; showed ability on the first of two hurdle runs but needs a fair bit more.

runners.name: Rhythm Of Life
runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage Des Loges
runners.comment: Fourth at Limerick but was behind some of today's rivals; cheekpieces need to work
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; the best of three maiden hurdle runs was when fourth at Limerick when making mistakes; she was behind Janes Harbour and Atlantic City then; poor at Clonmel since; cheekpieces need to eke out improvement.

runners.name: Chortal
runners.comment: Won Bellewstown maiden latest, poorly treated by race conditions, others preferred
runners.spotlight: Rated 115; gained first win over hurdles under positive ride in a modest Bellewstown maiden (2m1f, good) last month when the 2-5 favourite; carries a 7lb penalty for that win and poorly treated by the conditions of this race; others appeal more.

runners.name: Last Kingdom
runners.comment: Top-rated 129, solid handicap form the last twice, forecast rain a plus, the one to beat
runners.spotlight: Top-rated at 129; won a Fairyhouse handicap on penultimate off 115; second off 128 in valuable Killarney handicap latest; untried on quicker than yielding so the forecast rain is in his favour; the one to beat on these terms.

quotes.race: Farmhouse Foods Novice Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Mark [Walsh, jockey] said Last Kingdom has grown up a little bit since the last day. He said he jumped well and missed the last but still would have managed to win and he travelled away smoothly. He's happy on that ground and he might make into something like a Lartigue horse, he's only four - David Casey, trainer's assistant.

runners.name: Solar Drive
runners.comment: Dual-purpose, rated 121 won maiden here on good, handles soft, looks the main danger
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose; won a 2m2f maiden hurdle (good) here last September; placed in a Listed 4yo hurdle at Musselburgh in February before well beaten off 124 in the Fred Winter; modest efforts on Flat the last twice; has won on soft on the level; could prove to be the main danger.

quotes.race: GAIN The Advantage Series Handicap
quotes.quote: Solar Drive did it well and jumps hurdles as well. There's a 1m4f handicap at the Galway festival so hopefully he can get into that - Paul Flynn, trainer.

runners.name: Le Diablo
runners.breeder: M Eric Aubree & Mme Maryse Aubree
runners.comment: Promise in bumper here on debut, not so good latest, tough task on hurdles bow
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in a bumper here (2m1f, good) on debut when staying on late for a 12.5l fifth; not as good latest on yielding ground at Killarney; faces a tough task on hurdles debut.

runners.name: Pourquoi Poi
runners.comment: Long odds and never figured in both starts, unlikely to be the answer here
runners.spotlight: Sent off at triple figure odds for both starts in maidens at Cork and Down Royal and never figured; unlikely to be the answer here.

runners.name: A Snow White Park
runners.comment: Cheaply bought Walk In The Park filly, fell in sole point, will need to be smart to win
runners.spotlight: Cheaply bought Walk In The Park filly is out of a 2m4f hurdle and bumper winner; fell two out in sole point-to-point start; carries a nice low weight but will need to be pretty smart to win this on her racecourse debut.

runners.name: Come Home Sonny
runners.comment: Some encouragement in a Killarney maiden hurdle recently; still best watched
runners.spotlight: Only completed on one of his five point starts but showed some encouragement in a Killarney maiden hurdle recently; still best watched.

runners.name: Don Bosco
runners.comment: Interesting pedigree; given a favourable mention by his trainer recently; considered
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam poor maiden hurdler, out of unraced half-sister to 1m2f Group 3 winner/French Derby third Simeon and 14.6f Group 3 winner Noble Rose; unsold for 2,500euros as a 3yo but has an interesting pedigree; given a favourable mention by his trainer recently; considered.

runners.name: Eye On The Ball
runners.comment: By a decent sire and is worth checking for market confidence on debut
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam unplaced in bumper/2m-2m5f hurdles, sister to bumper/high-class 2m hurdle winner Darlan, from the family of French Oaks winner Daryaba; by a decent sire and is worth checking for market confidence on debut.

runners.name: Eyeeye
runners.comment: Promise when third at Kilbeggan; questions after being pulled-up at Killarney since
runners.spotlight: Modest Flat maiden was 80/1 but ran with some promise when third in a Kilbeggan maiden hurdle; questions after being pulled-up at Killarney since, even though was hampered.

runners.name: Kilooney Hill
runners.comment: Pulled-up in a Listowel bumper on debut last September; can only be watched on return
runners.spotlight: Pulled-up in a Listowel bumper on debut last September; can only be watched on return.

runners.name: Kushkame
runners.breeder: Ms M O'Neill & Mr J Davis
runners.comment: Tailed-off on hurdling debut in 2024; can only be watched on return
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in a Flat maiden on debut in 2020; tailed-off on hurdling debut in 2024; can only be watched on return.

runners.name: Mane Attraction
runners.comment: Showed some ability in two points before weakening; this trip may suit; still best watched
runners.spotlight: Showed some ability in two points before weakening; this trip may suit better but still best watched.

runners.name: Net Boy
runners.breeder: Mme Clarence Signol & M Xavier Brelaud
runners.comment: Best run last time; that was on testing ground but should be fine on this surface; player
runners.spotlight: Showed ability on the first of two bumper starts; was running well when unseating on hurdling debut but solid twice since, notably at Fairyhouse last time; that was on testing ground but should be fine on this surface; big player.

runners.name: Nitty Gritty
runners.comment: Bit better on second maiden hurdle start when last seen; cheekpieces removed; needs more
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten in two bumpers; a bit better on second maiden hurdle start when last seen; the cheekpieces worn then are removed; needs a fair bit of improvement.

runners.name: Noticebox
runners.comment: Decent effort on hurdling debut at Down Royal last time; needs more but hood may help
runners.spotlight: Held every chance when fell at the last on sole point start; inproved effort when fourth in a Bellewstown bumper and a similar effort on hurdling debut at Down Royal last time; needs more but first-time hood may help.

runners.name: The Gooses Acre
runners.comment: Minor promise in three bumper runs but 26l is the closest he has got so something to find
runners.spotlight: Minor promise in three bumper runs but 26l is the closest he has got so has something to find on hurdling debut.

runners.name: Bella Lu
runners.comment: Is of some interest on pedigree and could be capable of running well
runners.spotlight: Fifth foal; half-sister to 2m hurdle winner Blondes No More; dam dual bumper winner, out of Swedish 1m winning half-sister to 2,000 Guineas runner-up Even Top; is of some interest on pedigree and could be capable of running well.

runners.name: Eurielle
runners.comment: Modest Flat maiden was pulled-up on hurdling debut at Navan in March; can only be watched
runners.spotlight: Modest Flat maiden was pulled-up on hurdling debut at Navan in March; can only be watched.

runners.name: Hometomayo
runners.comment: Well beaten in a bumper and pulled-up in a point; can only be watched on hurdling debut
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in a bumper and pulled-up in a point; can only be watched on hurdling debut.

runners.name: Western Princess
runners.comment: Better at Wexford last time (2m4f) and the champion trainer perseveres with her
runners.spotlight: Raced too keenly when beaten a long way in a bumper and a maiden hurdle 512 days apart; a bit better at Wexford last time (2m4f) and the champion trainer perseveres with her so not ruled out.

runners.name: Kamikaz Du Plessis
runners.breeder: Mlle Severine Sourd & M Jean-Pierre Andriau
runners.comment: Placed in both point starts last year and would be of some interest if getting in; reserve
runners.spotlight: Reserve; placed in both point starts last year and would be of some interest if getting a run on rules debut.

7:00.race_name: Monroe's Live John & Margaret Monroe Memorial Mares Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: First Dare
runners.comment: Three hurdle wins; not a bad effort at Killarney last time but maybe a touch high in h'cap
runners.spotlight: Three hurdle wins, the last coming at Tramore in 2024; not a bad effort at Killarney last time when beaten 7l but is still maybe a touch high in handicap.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Ladies Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: First Dare had been hitting the crossbar and we were wondering would it ever happen. She got a beautiful ride and these races are determined by the experienced riders. It's great to get a win out of her and a little Flat race is not out of the question further down the line - Liz Doyle, trainer.

runners.name: Dame Rapide
runners.comment: Eight wins under all rules incl' over C&D; has won off a break in the past so respected
runners.spotlight: Eight wins under all rules including over C&D plus placed over fences; has won off a break in the past so respected on seasonal debut for a new (fifth) trainer.

quotes.race: Powerscreen New England Supporting Louth GAA Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: The ground was key to Dame Rapide today. She's been running well all year and she deserved that. She's a lovely honest mare and I think she's improving as she's getting older. Hopefully there is more to come from her and she'll jump a fence too in time - James Barrett, trainer.

quotes.race: Download The App At Novibet Handicap
quotes.quote: Dame Rapide was always a bit buzzy and keen but she's relaxed more at home and is finishing her races real well now. She jumps hurdles well but was in season the last day in Cork and never showed up. We'll probably mix and match it with her and hopefully we can go back and win a hurdle with her - James Barrett, trainer

quotes.race: William Hill Scratch Of The Day Handicap
quotes.quote: Dame Rapide is still improving and I don't know where she's going to stop or where she's going to go next. We said we'd come here, we thought we were out of our depth but we weren't. We'll probably have to look for something bigger and see where she lies, probably Group 3 or Listed now - Barry Fitzgerald, trainer.

runners.name: Fratas
runners.comment: Runner-up last hurdle start and on the Flat since; should go well again off the same mark
runners.spotlight: Five Flat wins plus a maiden hurdle; runner-up last hurdle start at Bellewstown and on the Flat at Sligo since; should go well again off the same mark.

quotes.race: Starting Point 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Fratas is a good hurdler, we have known that for a while. She had a hard season on the Flat and she deserves a break. She will be better on better ground, that was tough work today - Mick Mulvany, trainer

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies & Mares Handicap
quotes.quote: Fratas is tough. I knew today, bringing her back in trip, that you'd have to stay. The first two went some gallop and I thought they might run out of petrol, but they didn't. She showed her toughness the whole way to the line. That's her fifth win since she joined me and you wouldn't know where we'd go after this - Mick Mulvany, trainer

quotes.race: Newtown Fillies Handicap
quotes.quote: Fratas is a very tough and honest filly. I thought Jamie (Powell) gave her a great ride, we were going to track one or two of them and I said to him if there's no pace on to jump out in front. He got the inside berth which I think around here makes a big difference. She seems to be very versatile - Michael Mulvany, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Bay Leaf Handicap
quotes.quote: Fratas had been poorly away so we did a lot of work on that and Gary is deadly from the front at tracks like this. I think she'll get further with time - Mick Mulvany, trainer.

runners.name: Miss Gherkin
runners.comment: Fine run after a break on debut for this yard; raised 3lb; has run well in defeat here
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner put up a fine run after a break on debut for this yard when runner-up at Clonmel; raised 3lb but might be able to progress enough to defy that; has run well in defeat here before.

runners.name: She Is Electric
runners.comment: Dual hurdle winner incl' over C&D; pulled-up over fences back after having a foal
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner including over C&D in 2022; was pulled-up over fences last time having come back after having a foal; can only be watched for now.

quotes.race: Pat Walsh Memorial Irish EBF Mares Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: We said we'd try and steal a march on them - if you're not brave you're nothing in life. Robbie gave She Is Electric a super ride. We always knew she was a decent filly - she had a few little problems early on - but she's a valuable filly now, a proper little one. She's a handicapper to jump, she'd jump out of jail for you - Norman Lee, trainer

runners.name: Flidais
runners.comment: Won over fences in spring and not a bad C&D fourth; below form at Kilbeggan since
runners.spotlight: A C&D winner last year and won over fences at Clonmel in the spring; not a bad run when fourth back over C&D two starts ago but was below form at Kilbeggan since.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Maiden Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Flidais is a really nice filly. She has speed and class and she will stay well. She will be aimed for Galway - John Ryan, trainer

runners.name: Andyourbirdcansing
runners.comment: Runner-up at Limerick before unseating early last time; likely to be competitive
runners.spotlight: Record of 1-17 over hurdles; runner-up at Limerick before unseating early last time at Kilbeggan; likely to be competitive if avoiding jumping mistakes.

runners.name: Maxios Prime
runners.owner: Living Life To The Maxios Syndicate
runners.comment: Improved when winning a Fairyhouse h'cap and a fine Cheltenham 3rd since; can go well
runners.spotlight: Showed improved form when winning a Fairyhouse handicap in February, beating Janes Harbour (runs earlier on card); a fine third in a Cheltenham handicap since; can go well.

runners.name: Brilliant Question
runners.comment: A 9l runner-up at Gowran last hurdle run; poor there on Flat since; 4lb out of the h'cap
runners.spotlight: Record of 1-15 over hurdles; was a 9l runner-up at Gowran last hurdle run but was poor there on the Flat since; 4lb out of the handicap.

quotes.race: Follow Limerick Racecourse On Instagram Opportunity Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: She worked very well during the week and loves soft ground so  we thought Brilliant Question had a good chance. I was meant to jump off last but she was a bit keen in my hands, but she went to the line strongly - Robbie Geoghegan, rider, talking to Racing TV.

runners.name: I Am Mimi
runners.comment: H'cap debutant, promise in maidens, opening mark looks fair, lacks a run, check market
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutant has shown promise in all three of his maiden hurdles at 2m-2m3f; ran respectably here in a 16.5f bumper a year ago; opening mark looks fair and he is worth a market check on return from 263 days off.

runners.name: W B Easy
runners.comment: H'cap debutant, minor promise in maidens, hood discarded, tongue tie returns, watch
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutant has shown minor promise in three starts over hurdles and two bumpers at 2m-2m1f; hood worn for latest defeat here is discarded and the tongue tie returns; probably best watched.

runners.name: Away To Milan
runners.comment: Won off 10lb lower in May 2023, has placed off this mark, ground versatile, cheekpieces on
runners.spotlight: Is 1-13 over hurdles; last won in May 2023 at Wexford (17.5f, good) off 93; 10lb higher now but has run well off this mark before and is ground versatile; may have needed latest and could do better in first time cheekpieces.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Away To Milan looks like a work in progress and is getting his act together. This was a lesser contest and a great opportunity. We'll give him a little break now - Philip Rothwell, trainer.

runners.name: Gordons Aura
runners.comment: Winless since February 2023, hasn't looked a winner in waiting recently, needs more
runners.spotlight: Won a Fairyhouse maiden for Gordon Elliott back in February 2023 (2m, yielding); no joy since and hasn't looked a winner in waiting in three runs for this yard; mark sliding but needs more.

quotes.race: Bulmers Bundle For Easter Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Gordons Aura took a bit of a look in front but once he was joined he put his head down and battled. It wasn't easy but it worked out well - Jordan Gainford, rider.

runners.name: Katherine
runners.comment: Three-time hurdles winner, won off 5lb lower in October, may be in handicapper's grip
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner over timber; last victory came at Fairyhouse in October (2m, good) off 97; struggled off revised mark since and was well beaten on the Flat on latest; may need more respite from the handicapper.

quotes.race: Sign Up & Save With Fairyhouse.ie Mares Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We were confident coming here today. Katherine is an unbelievable jumper and that's a massive help to her. She's been tricky to train and there have been little things we've started to figure out with her - Harry Sexton, jockey.

quotes.race: TipperaryRaces.ie Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Katherine had some good runs in bumpers but we always thought she would be better over hurdles. We like her a lot and we did fancy her today and she handled it really well today. She jumps really well - Harry Sexton, rider.

runners.name: Katakana
runners.comment: Dual French bumper winner, ok run on h'cap debut last July, lacks a run but can't discount
runners.spotlight: Dual bumper winner on testing ground in France is 0-4 over hurdles; shaped okay on handicap debut at Tipperary last July when a 7.75l seventh of 18 over 2m on yielding; decent effort on chase debut when last seen in September; ran well in a C&D maiden last year; lacks a run but not discounted for top yard.

runners.name: Brave Soldier
runners.comment: Is 0-4 over timber, minor promise on h'cap debut, down 1lb but more needed
runners.spotlight: Is 0-4 over hurdles; minor promise in maidens and on handicap debut at Kilbeggan last time (15.5f, gd-yld) but was still beaten 16l; down 1lb but needs more off this mark.

runners.name: Desert Haven
runners.comment: Flat winner, heavy defeats last two starts over hurdles, others make more appeal
runners.spotlight: Two-time Flat winner is 0-5 over hurdles; in okay form on the level recently but has suffered heavy defeats on last two starts in this sphere; others make more appeal.

quotes.race: SPIN1038 Handicap
quotes.quote: Desert Haven's last two runs last season were disappointing but he was getting a little raspy of his wind and we did a little job on it and I'd say it helped him a bit. Colin (Keane) is adamant that he's better on a turning track so you'd imagine Galway could come into the equation at some stage - Noel Meade, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Dream Shaper
runners.comment: 0-8 over hurdles, hasn't built on promising Galway fifth, others look more likely
runners.spotlight: Eighteen race maiden is 0-8 over hurdles; caught the eye when running on late for a 5l fifth of 20 at Galway (16.5f, yld-sft) last September off 3lb higher but hasn't replicated that since; may have needed latest but others look more likely.

runners.name: Only One Plan
runners.comment: Locally trained two-time winner, may have needed latest, not discounted at a price.
runners.spotlight: Two-time hurdles winner; scored off 95 at Downpatrick (2m2f, good) last September for Philip Rothwell and 4lb higher now; shaped as though the run was needed on debut for this local yard latest; handles cut and has run well here before; not discounted at a price.

runners.name: Order Of The Dance
runners.comment: Improved for handicaps, second the last twice, drops in trip, claims, rain a query
runners.spotlight: Is 0-5 over hurdles but has improved for handicaps; beaten 1.5l off 95 at Kilbeggan (15.5f, gd-yld) and 5l when second of 12 at Clonmel (19.5f, good) off 99 in first-time cheekpieces (retained); obvious chance back in trip but soft ground would be a query.

runners.name: Leitzel
runners.comment: Flat winner, promise in maiden hurdles, struggled in handicaps, lacks a run, best watched
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose Flat winner is 0-7 over hurdles but has run well in defeat in maidens; struggled in handicaps and pulled up when last seen at Cork in November; best watched on return.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The ground was probably tight enough for Leitzel today and she didn't travel around as well as she did the last day. She's still quite nervous and green and hopefully she's only going to go one way. It was a good performance and she could be a nice filly next year - Danny Tudhope, rider.

stable_tour.quote: She won her first two last year and then wasn't suited by the seven furlongs in the Rockfel. She'll stay a mile and a quarter and we'll start her back up in trip, possibly at York. 04-05-23

runners.name: Whatsitabout
runners.breeder: Mme Benedicte Barrier, M Valentin Barrier & Mme Laura Gavrel
runners.comment: 0-4 over hurdles, pulled up when last seen in July, h'cap debutant is best watched
runners.spotlight: Is 0-4 over hurdles; best effort a 17l fifth of 23 in a Cork maiden (2m, heavy) but that was in November 2022; pulled up when last seen in July; best watched on handicap debut.

runners.name: Hobart
runners.comment: 0-3 over hurdles, fell when 125-1 at Gowran, opening mark doesn't look generous
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose maiden; 0-3 over hurdles; opening mark doesn't look a gift on what he has shown so far; fell when 125-1 on latest start in this sphere in a Gowran maiden; others appeal more.

runners.name: Zero Fighter
runners.owner: Mrs Lisa Delany & Mrs Tahnee Grant
runners.comment: Won on Flat latest, has generally struggled over timber, beaten 18l latest, rain a worry
runners.spotlight: Two-time Flat winner at a modest level; won two weeks ago on the level at Roscommon (7.5f, good); has been well beaten all five starts over timber; down 2lb for 18l defeat last start in this sphere but needs more; rain would be a concern.

runners.name: Dream Escape
runners.comment: Flat winner, good third off this mark in October, ground versatile but may need this run
runners.spotlight: Flat winner is 0-9 over hurdles; best run in this sphere a 2.25l third of 14 at Gowran off this mark in October (2m, good); off since 9l sixth of 18 at Thurles in November; ground versatile but may need this run after absence.

runners.name: Max Time
runners.comment: Won over further at Galway last September, poor effort latest, trip a worry; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; won off 80 at Galway last September (2m6f, gd-yld); beaten 54l over 21.5f (good) here on latest; this trip looks too short; others preferred.

runners.name: Boston Jury
runners.comment: H'cap debutant, won Down Royal maiden, unseated at the start latest, rain a concern
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutant; improved to beat well fancied rival in third maiden hurdle (2m4f, good) at Down Royal; unseated at the start on latest; could resume progress but may not want too much rain.

runners.name: Jolie Jewel
runners.breeder: M Arnaud Chaille-Chaille & M Pascal Magne
runners.comment: Improved h'cap efforts last three times, go well again if rain misses
runners.spotlight: Won a Cork maiden hurdle just over a year ago (2m3f, good); improved back there in a handicap on penultimate when beaten 2.5l off 108; two more solid second place efforts here on last two starts; can go well again if turning out and there isn't too much rain.

runners.name: Spinning Web
runners.comment: Won back to back chases at Thurles in March, 14lb lower over hurdles, needs rain to miss
runners.spotlight: In excellent form at Thurles in March, winning back to back chases at around this trip; pulled up dropped back to 16.5f at Punchestown latest; reverts to hurdles off 14lb lower than chase rating and steps back up in trip; wouldn't want to see much rain.

quotes.race: Junction 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Spinning Web has been woken up by hurdles and he adapted quickly at home. Hopefully that will make him brave enough to win over further on the Flat - Danny Mullins, rider.

runners.name: Tell Nobody Nothin
runners.comment: Maiden winner, best efforts on good ground, chance but rain would be a concern
runners.spotlight: Downpatrick maiden hurdle winner at 2m2f; has run with credit all three handicap hurdle starts on good ground, beaten just 2.75l at Cork latest; chance off the same mark but rain a concern.

quotes.race: Downpatrick Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Tell Nobody Nothin travelled great. He had a break over the summer and I'm thrilled with him. We'll take it steady, we'll look for a rated novice with him or something like that - Noel Meade, trainer.

runners.name: Tomas O Maille
runners.comment: Won here last time, up 5lb, ground versatile, should go well again upped slightly in trip
runners.spotlight: Local challenger shed the maiden tag over 21.5f (good) here last month; should go well again upped slightly in trip off 5lb higher and he is ground versatile; claims.

runners.name: Good World
runners.comment: Veteran is a four-time winner, won off 5lb lower last August, may need this after break
runners.spotlight: Veteran is a four-time winner over hurdles; scored off 98 at Kilbeggan (18.5f, gd-yld) last August; beaten off revised mark twice since and has been off since October; may need this run.

quotes.race: Follow Tipperary Races On Twitter Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Chasing didn't work out and for a horse who jumps so well you'd swear Good World never saw a fence in his life at Tramore. The break worked. The ground is lovely but as quick as he wants it. Hopefully, there will be another one in him before he gets a break for the winter. He is a small, handy horse - Eoin Griffin, trainer.

runners.name: Je Suis
runners.comment: Point winner, mild promise in maidens, worth a market check on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner is 0-4 over timber; mild promise in maidens; beaten 15l when fourth of 15 at Cork latest (3m, good), weakening late on; drops back in trip for handicap debut; worth a market check.

runners.name: Westernersunrise
runners.comment: Won off 6lb lower on soft in February, off since, claims if in the same form on return
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark at the seventh attempt over hurdles in Fairyhouse handicap in February (2m4f, soft); raised 6lb for that and has been off since; rain would be a plus and she should go well again if she returns in similar form.

runners.name: Ballinoe Blaze
runners.comment: Ran well at Limerick on penultimate, 1lb lower now, place chance with a repeat of that
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden produced his best handicap run on penultimate start at Limerick (21.5f, good) when a 2.75l third of 8 off 97; didn't back that up at Cork on latest; place chance if reproducing that Limerick run off 1lb lower.

runners.name: Derby Rock
runners.comment: Handicap debutant, no impact in maidens but well-bred and could improve, check market
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutant has shown just minor promise in a trio of maidens at 2m-20.5f; doesn't look obviously well-treated but he's well-related (half-brother to Benefficient) and could be capable of better; check the market.

runners.name: Evans Secret
runners.comment: 0-9 over hurdles, traffic problems when third latest, has placed C&D form, rain a worry
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose maiden; 0-9 over hurdles; didn't get the clearest of runs when a 7.25l third of 15 at Sligo last time out; ran well over this C&D a year ago when a 1l second of 16 off 5lb lower; rain would be a worry, chance if it misses.

runners.name: Kingkong Ciergues
runners.comment: Handles soft ground, went close on penultimate, not as good latest, needs more up in trip
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner is 0-6 over hurdles; best effort a head second on heavy ground at Fairyhouse in February (2m4f); beaten 11l off 3lb higher on latest at Gowran (2m4f, soft); won't mind if it rains but needs a bit more stepped up in trip.

runners.name: Ladiam
runners.comment: Winless since 2022, hasn't shown enough since return from layoff, tongue tie now tried
runners.spotlight: Won a Sligo maiden in 2022 but winless since; hasn't shown a lot since return from a long layoff in October; beaten 17l here latest and now tries a tongue tie; mark sliding but others appeal more.

runners.name: Tannery Park
runners.comment: Maiden, promise on return at Cork, ran well here on the Flat on soft, interesting
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose maiden; yet to hit the frame in six starts over hurdles but didn't run too badly at Cork (2m4f, good) on his return from a 254-day break; has run well here on the Flat on soft and stays 2m in that sphere; looks well worth a go at this trip; interesting.

runners.name: Ballagh Star
runners.comment: Chase winner, 0-13 over hurdles, has run ok here before, ground versatile, may outrun odds
runners.spotlight: Chase winner is 0-13 over hurdles; has been mixing both codes recently; couldn't take advantage of lower hurdles mark at Punchestown on penultimate; ground versatile and has run respectably here before; could outrun odds.

runners.name: Weather Alert
runners.comment: 0-5 over timber, no impact in first two h'cap hurdles, could do better if rain arrives
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose maiden is 0-5 over timber; hasn't shown enough in two handicap hurdles to be of interest here, though could improve if the ground turns soft (has run well on soft on the Flat).

runners.name: Blossom De Mai
runners.breeder: Mme Irene Scheldt & M Andrew Scheldt
runners.owner: J Humphreys/Exors Of The Late F Byrne/N Courtney/D Odwyer

prev_owners.owner: J Humphreys & F Byrne & N Courtney & D O' Dwyer
Jonathan Humphreys & Felix Byrne & Nick Courtney
J Humphreys & F Byrne & N Courtney & P J Rothwell

runners.comment: 3lb above last win, lacks a recent run, best watched on return from absence; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; 1-13 over hurdles, the win coming in November 2023 at Tramore (2m5f, soft); remains 3lb above that last success and has been off since last April; probably best watched on return.

runners.name: Sydney Cruiser
runners.comment: 0-16, has run well here before over shorter, out of form recently, cheekpieces on; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; 0-16 over hurdles; ran well over 2m1f here last August on easy ground; steps up in trip after a couple of modest efforts at Clonmel and Sligo and wears cheekpieces now; others preferred.

runners.name: Shing Shilla
runners.breeder: Lynch Bages Ltd & Edge Ridge Ltd
runners.comment: 0-7, glimmers of promise, may have needed latest, watch up in trip; 1lb wrong; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; 0-7 over hurdles; has shown a glimmer of promise and should strip fitter for her comeback run at Down Royal on latest; this trip is an unknown so probably best watched; 1lb wrong.

runners.name: Doctor Steinberg
runners.comment: Promise in both starts a year apart, form of last run boosted, obvious chance for top yard
runners.spotlight: Well-bred sort showed promise in both starts a year apart; third of 14 on heavy at Fairyhouse and then a 2.75l second of 15 on good at Clonmel two months ago; that form has been boosted by the winner and he has obvious claims for leading yard.

runners.name: Durbani
runners.comment: Arctic Cosmos gelding, dam a 2m4f winner, well beaten in sole point, can only be watched
runners.spotlight: Arctic Cosmos gelding; dam a 2m4f hurdle winner; beaten 35l in sole point-to-point start at Quakerstown last month; can only be watched on Rules' debut.

runners.name: Go To Town
runners.comment: Improved effort over hurdles latest when 6-1, place chance back in bumper if builds on it
runners.spotlight: No impact in first two starts in bumpers at big prices but produced an improved display to finish a 7.25l fourth of 11 on hurdling debut at Kilbeggan (2m, good) when sent off at 6-1; place claims if building on that.

runners.name: Hickeys Hill
runners.comment: Point winner bought for 32,000Euros, tongue tied for racecourse debut, check market
runners.spotlight: Quakerstown point-to-point winner fetched 32,000Euros at Goresbridge in November; Hillstar gelding is tongue tied for his racecourse debut; check the market.

runners.name: Jisco Du Brem
runners.breeder: J L Couetil & Mme J L Couetil
runners.comment: Had excuse when well beaten favourite on debut last July, off since, worth a market check
runners.spotlight: Spanish Moon gelding finished well beaten when the 5-6 favourite on debut at Wexford but had an excuse (mucus found in trachea); off since that run in July and will be interesting to see if his backers return.

runners.name: Jurado
runners.comment: 10-1 when midfield and beaten 20l on debut, should improve but much more needed to win
runners.spotlight: Lawman gelding showed a glimmer of promise when midfield at 10-1 on debut at Kilbeggan (15.5f, gd-yld) but was still beaten 20l; should improve for that initial experience but will need a lot more to win this.

runners.name: Mystical Sandmason
runners.comment: 33-1 and never sighted in Sligo maiden hurdle on debut, down in trip, may need more time
runners.spotlight: 33-1 and always behind when pulled up on debut in a Sligo maiden hurdle last month; son of Sandmason drops in trip and switches to a bumper; may need more time.

runners.name: Ned In The Park
runners.comment: 0-3 in bumpers, midfield over hurdles last twice, hood on, could run well if turns soft
runners.spotlight: Is 0-5 under Rules'; ran okay in a Thurles bumper on second start last February on testing ground; midfield in maiden hurdles the last twice; hood goes on for return to bumper; has often attracted market support; could run well if the rain comes.

runners.name: Rapid Redemption
runners.comment: Doyen gelding, brother to listed bumper winner, top yard, market should reveal plenty
runners.spotlight: Doyen gelding cost 15,000Euros as a yearling; twelfth foal; brother to Listed bumper and point winner Rapid Escape, closely related to useful bumper and 2m hurdle/chase winner Nicolas Chauvin; dam unraced half-sister to useful 2m-2m4f hurdle/chase winner Chauvinist; well-bred, top yard and market should reveal plenty.

runners.name: Rosies Wings
runners.comment: Wings Of Eagles gelding, dam a 2m hurdle and Flat winner, hooded, check market
runners.spotlight: Wings Of Eagles gelding is a first foal; dam 10.6f AW (RPR 72) and 2m hurdle winner, is granddaughter of bumper and 2m3f/2m4f hurdle winning sister to smart staying chaser Heltornic; hooded for debut but not a bad pedigree and worth a market check.

runners.name: Townscupsixtythree
runners.comment: Valirann gelding beat just one rival home on debut twelve days ago, may need more time
runners.spotlight: Sent off at 28-1 for debut and beat just one rival home at Clonmel twelve days ago; Valirann gelding may need more time.

runners.name: Kilmore Dragon
runners.comment: Tailed off when 150-1 on debut last month, tongue tie goes on, safe to rule out
runners.spotlight: Dragon Pulse gelding sent off at 150-1 for debut at Punchestown late last month and tailed off; tongue tie goes on; seems safe to rule out.

runners.name: Akmaam
runners.comment: Regressive on the Flat in the last two years; can only be watched on hurdling debut
runners.spotlight: Two Flat wins but has been regressive in the last two years; can only be watched on hurdling debut.

quotes.race: Stella Artois British EBF Novice Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Akmaam's a lovely colt and has always been a favourite at home. He's a big boy and very much a three-year-old in the making. My instinct would tell me that we go softly for a while and look at maybe one more run this year, but we'll speak to the owners and get some more feedback from Martin as well - Brian Meehan, trainer.

runners.name: Brave Crogha
runners.comment: Bumper winner was poor in two hurdle attempts in 2023 but is a better horse now
runners.spotlight: Sprang a 200/1 shock when winning a Galway bumper last year but twice ran well in winners' races after; tailed-off on return at Punchestown; was poor in two hurdle attempts in 2023 but is a better horse now; not ignored.

runners.name: Come On The Lads
runners.comment: Third in a Killarney handicap last time and that form entitles him to be involved
runners.spotlight: Three-time Flat winner posted his best hurdling effort when third in a Killarney handicap last time over this trip; can race keenly and could do with settling better but that form entitles him to be involved.

quotes.race: William Hill More Top Prices Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Come On The Lads had a good run the last day in Galway, and he is probably very versatile on ground, he has won on heavy. Hopefully, he is on the improve - Rob Whearty, rider

runners.name: Fairbanks
runners.comment: Just denied on hurdling debut at Down Royal; will take beating with improvement likely
runners.spotlight: Very useful on the Flat for Andrew Balding, rated 102 in that sphere; bought by current connections for 65,000gns last autumn; just denied on hurdling debut at Down Royal recently and will take beating today with improvement likely.

quotes.race: bet365 Trophy (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: With the blinkers on I wanted to ride Fairbanks further forward than I did, but he only jumped fairly so I didn't want to rush him up. It was a muddling tempo and he over raced around the bend, but he relaxed when I stopped fighting him. I didn't want him to be crowded with the blinkers on, so I sent him on a good way out and he was going to take a lot of beating from there. He could creep into the Ebor off his rating, but there is also a valuable consolation race too if Andrew [Balding, trainer] wants to go that route - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

runners.name: Firebrand
runners.comment: Ran well in a strong Fairyhouse maiden hurdle last winter; a player if ready on return
runners.spotlight: Won a Flat maiden at Roscommon last October and ran a fine race in a strong Fairyhouse maiden hurdle after, his third hurdle start; a player if ready on return.

runners.name: Annilogs Force
runners.comment: Tailed-off on maiden hurdle debut and blinkers replace cheekpieces; can't be fancied
runners.spotlight: Tailed-off on maiden hurdle debut at Fairyhouse and blinkers replace cheekpieces; can't be fancied.

runners.name: At The Wings
runners.comment: Runner-up in Sligo bumper last year; tailed-off in a maiden hurdle at same track last time
runners.spotlight: Best run in four bumpers when runner-up at Sligo last year; tailed-off in a maiden hurdle at same track last time.

runners.name: Gold Gatewood
runners.comment: Pulled-up and beaten 65l in two maiden hurdles so can't be fancied
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; pulled-up and beaten 65l in two maiden hurdles so can't be fancied.

runners.name: Rinnaseer Dream
runners.comment: Tailed-off in a Cork bumper on debut last month and can only be watched
runners.spotlight: Tailed-off in a Cork bumper on debut last month and can only be watched; tongue-tie added.

runners.name: Shore
runners.comment: Dual-purpose maiden has been poor in three maiden hurdles and can't be fancied
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose maiden has been poor in three maiden hurdles and can't be fancied.

runners.name: Will Harbut
runners.comment: Looked unsuited by a slowly run bumper at Killarney; could run well but others preferred
runners.spotlight: Was well fancied but pulled-up in two point starts; looked unsuited by a slowly run bumper at Killarney since; could run well but others preferred.

runners.name: Young And Foolish
runners.comment: Tailed-off in a Fairyhouse maiden hurdle on debut and can't be fancied
runners.spotlight: Tailed-off in a Fairyhouse maiden hurdle on debut and can't be fancied.

runners.name: Hope She Flies
runners.comment: Dual purpose pedigree; will need to be well forward to score on debut
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; half-sister to bumper, 1m6f-2m Flat (RPR 92) and 2m4f hurdle winner One More Go; dam unraced half-sister to winners Cape Presto (6f-1m) and Cape Vincent (7f); dual purpose pedigree; will need to be well forward to score on debut.

runners.name: La Gordita
runners.comment: Was beaten when falling at two out on debut; best watched for now
runners.spotlight: Raced keenly on debut at Kilbeggan and was beaten when falling at two out; best watched for now.

runners.name: Roxy Lor
runners.comment: Homebred is by a useful sire but will have to be well forward to win on debut
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; dam placed in points, sister to bumper winner En Joule, out of unraced sister to bumper and smart 2m1f-3m chase winner The Tother One; homebred is by a useful sire but will have to be well forward to win on debut.

runners.name: Church Mountain
runners.comment: Handicap winner two runs back and could have a part to play on first start in a claimer
runners.spotlight: Well held last time but had previously won a 1m soft-ground handicap at Limerick and could have a part to play on first start in a claimer.

quotes.race: William Hill Lengthen Your Odds Handicap
quotes.quote: Church Mountain has taken a while to come around to our way of thinking but we got him started at Leopardstown a couple of weeks ago and ran a lovely race. It gave us confidence to drop him in because he's won his other races for Denis Hogan making it. He looked like he won snug enough at the line so hopefully he'll be able to go to Galway and be competitive - Michael O'Callaghan, trainer, talking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Limerick Racecourse Handicap
quotes.quote: You'd call stall 18 a bad draw usually, but not with Church Mountain because he doesn't like traffic around him. If he's drawn low and misses the break, it can be hard for him to get going, but Dan is super value for his 7lb claim off those weights. This horse has won twice at Galway and hopefully will go back there. Even though he's a big horse, he seems to like good ground - Denis Hogan, trainer

quotes.race: James P. Cunningham Electrical Handicap
quotes.quote: Church Mountain picked up well and did everything for me today. I'd say he's going to make a lovely dual purpose horse, he won't be a horse until next year - Joey Sheridan, jockey.

quotes.race: Kenny Galway Volvo Handicap
quotes.quote: Church Mountain is one we always liked, but he's a massive horse and still not the finished article. He was green in front but he needed to be there because he is a 1m2f horse. Making the running was the making of him - Denis Hogan, trainer.

runners.name: Spy
runners.comment: Competitive over hurdles last summer and didn't run too badly back on the Flat last week
runners.spotlight: Competitive over hurdles last summer and didn't run too badly back on the Flat last week (1m2f handicap); that was after a lengthy break.

runners.name: The Real Screamer
runners.comment: Record of 2-11 and competitive shows in recent handicaps bode well now into a claimer
runners.spotlight: Record of 2-11 and competitive shows in recent handicaps bode well now dropped into a claimer; shortlisted.

runners.name: Yes Oui Si
runners.comment: No wins in ten but finished third in three maidens; unseated at the start last time
runners.spotlight: No wins in ten but finished third in three maidens and was only 7-1 for a Leopardstown handicap last time when unseating at the start.

runners.name: Roman Harry
runners.comment: Has only won at Laytown; beaten 6l in a Gowran claimer last week over 7f
runners.spotlight: Has only won at Laytown; beaten 6l in a Gowran claimer last week over 7f; this might be more his trip but others are more likely at the weights.

runners.name: Ameilya
runners.comment: Modest hurdle form but a 1m maiden winner and the highest rated of these
runners.spotlight: Hasn't shown much over hurdles in her last four races but she's a 1m maiden winner and the highest rated of these; cheekpieces tried.

runners.name: Benavente

prev_owners.owner: Frank J Lynch & Michael Hartnett & W O'Brien & A M Ryan

runners.comment: All wins and best form has been on the AW but could still be a factor at this level
runners.spotlight: All wins and best form has been on the AW but could still be a factor at this level and Colin Keane is booked.

quotes.race: Parkview Provisions Handicap
quotes.quote: Benavente got a good ride from Joey. He left it late. We might put him in a claimer again. He has paid his way now - Kevin Coleman, trainer

runners.name: Signor Ferrari
runners.comment: Couldn't get going in time when a beaten favourite in latest AW claimer over 7f
runners.spotlight: Four Flat wins divided between turf and the AW; couldn't get going in time when a beaten favourite in latest AW claimer over 7f and returning to further should help; considered.

quotes.race: Fairyhouse Summer Season Claiming Race
quotes.quote: Signor Ferrari is a nice horse. He has a good turn of foot for a 1m2f horse and he stays well - Hugh Horgan, rider.

quotes.race: Blackwater Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: I felt Signor Ferrari ran well last time at Killarney, finished fifth and was unlucky in running, didn't have a hard race and I thought he had a bit of a chance today.  He's pretty versatile ground-wise, he got there pretty easily and stuck his down when it mattered. Hopefully he'll gain confidence from that - Hugh Horgan, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Ivasecret
runners.comment: Exposed 7yo who has only won on the AW and faces a tough task on these terms
runners.spotlight: Exposed 7yo who has only won on the AW and faces a tough task on these terms.

stable_tour.quote: He has found life frustrating this season trying to give weight to progressive three-year-olds. He started the campaign on a good note with a win at Lingfield in the spring but has finished second twice since in four completed starts. His mark of 82 on the all-weather looks high enough now - he's 77 on turf. He could be going to the October sales for his owners to reinvest in a yearling but he's clearly capable of winning more races. 23-09-22

runners.name: Lohengrin
runners.comment: Remains a maiden (0-17) and looks vulnerable on the balance of his form
runners.spotlight: Close third to Roman Harry in a 7f maiden at Laytown last September but then well behind Church Mountain in a handicap; cheekpieces added.

runners.name: Tartaraghan
runners.comment: 0-22 but runs well now and again, as when not far away in a Cork handicap last week
runners.spotlight: 22-race maiden but runs well now and again, as when not far away in a Cork handicap last week (1m2f); each-way claims should some of these underperform.

runners.name: Bungle Inthedesert
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late Mrs Eileen Heanen & Noel Heanen
runners.comment: The winner of two 1m handicaps at Dundalk; doesn't seem as effective on turf
runners.spotlight: The winner of two 1m handicaps at Dundalk; doesn't seem as effective on turf and well held at Gowran last week.

quotes.race: Friday 12th July Ladies Day At Dundalk Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Bungle Inthedesert was there to be shot at and had plenty to do in the last furlong, but in fairness to him he did it. Thankfully, we stayed in front and he was good and game - Siobhan Rutledge, rider.

runners.name: La Tulipe Noire

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Magette Meagher & Thomas P Meagher

runners.comment: Regressive profile and limited appeal at these weights, even with a 10lb claimer up top
runners.spotlight: Has a regressive profile and limited appeal at these weights, even with a 10lb claimer up top.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF (Fillies) Maiden
quotes.quote: La Tulipe Noire jumped okay, there wasn't much pace on and I was able to dictate. The blinkers helped her. She was tough and always doing enough, Declan McDonogh, rider.

runners.name: Man Is King
runners.comment: Close fourth in a 1m handicap on penultimate run but now 0-34 and these terms are tough
runners.spotlight: Close fourth in a 1m handicap on penultimate run but now 0-34 and these terms are tough.

runners.name: Magic Charm
runners.comment: The winner of two 1m handicaps but some time ago and has regressed; rated only 44
runners.spotlight: The winner of two 1m handicaps but some time ago and has regressed; rated only 44.

quotes.race: Ornella Underwriting Ltd Equine And Bloodstock Insurance Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Magic Charm is a genuine horse but the blinkers maybe just helped him travel. He ran a savage race last day and we knew today that the stiff track and soft ground would help him - Martin Hassett, trainer.

quotes.race: Naas Welcomes Racing TV Members Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Magic Charm had a good solid run the last day and has proved to be competitive at this level before today. All the conditions were right so we were hopeful -Natalia Lupini, trainer

runners.name: Smaoineamh Sile
runners.comment: Some appeal on last season's peak form, including 1m1f handicap win at Leopardstown
runners.spotlight: Some appeal on last season's peak form, including 1m1f handicap win at Leopardstown; however, well below par on her last three starts.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Lengthen The Odds Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Smaoineamh Sile got an easy lead and she is good around here. I thought she might need the run. She stays 1m well, this trip is probably at the end of her stamina, and she will probably go to Bellewstown now - John McConnell, trainer.

quotes.race: Gibneys Malahide Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Smaoineamh Sile was game. She is what she is but she's competitive at her rating and hopefully she can go again - John McConnell, trainer.

quotes.race: Richmond Homes Handicap
quotes.quote: Smaoineamh Sile was given another good ride by Dylan. She was paddling a bit in the end but had been in front for a good bit and was entitled to get a bit lonely. She came forward for winning last time and hopefully can keep going as the handicapper is going to have his say again. The penny is dropping. That sort of trip suits her, and places like Killarney, front-running tracks, could work for her - John McConnell, trainer.

quotes.race: Sandyford Handicap
quotes.quote: Smaoineamh Sile likes to do things her own way. She came on for the run last day and Dylan gave her a peach of a ride - John McConnell, trainer

runners.name: Knockmore Prince
runners.comment: Reserve; longstanding maiden with a basement handicap mark and up against it
runners.spotlight: Reserve; longstanding maiden with a basement handicap mark and up against it.

5:50.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Median Auction Maiden

runners.name: Four White Fury
runners.comment: Cheaply bought yearling; newcomer looks the yard's second string
runners.spotlight: Cityscape gelding cost just 2,000gns as a yearling; half-brother to five winners inc Elegiac (1m-1m6f inc 2yo/AW/Listed; RPR 109), Lawless Secret (1m2f; 91), Choirmaster (7.4f/1m 2yo, 85; 2m hurdle) and Eesha's Smile (7.4f/1m 2yo; 78); dam Italian 1m/US 1m4f winner (100); newcomer looks the yard's second string.

runners.name: Kevin The Great
runners.comment: Some debut promise in 1m2f Navan maiden; back in trip here and likely improver
runners.spotlight: Saxon Warrior half-brother to winners Arqoob (1m-1m4f Flat inc AW, RPR 98; 2m hurdle), Chimney Rock (German 1m1f/1m3f; 96) and Dromantine (7f AW 2yo; 79); dam 6f/7f winner (inc AW; 96); yard outsider on recent debut but showed some promise in 1m2f Navan maiden without landing a blow; back in trip here and likely improver.

runners.name: Minella Study
runners.comment: Out of depth on comeback; some promise here last autumn but more needed
runners.spotlight: Definite merit in 1m1f maiden run here last October, never sighted when stiff task on reappearance at Cork last month; probably more one for handicaps and bred to want further.

runners.name: Petes Dream
runners.comment: No luck in running but not beaten far on Leopardstown debut; should have more to offer
runners.spotlight: Keen, no luck in running but not beaten that far on Leopardstown debut 16 days ago; should have a good bit more more to offer, enough to feature in what appears an ordinary maiden.

runners.name: Shanlieve
runners.comment: 44,000 euros yearling; market best guide on debut
runners.spotlight: Saxon Warrior gelding cost 44,000Euros as a yearling; second foal; half-brother to Listed-placed 10.4f winner Expected Arrival (RPR 92); dam 1m2f/1m4f winner (96), half-sister to winners Making Miracles (2m2f Chester Cup) and Earlswood (1m/1m2f Group 3); market best guide on debut.

runners.name: Sonoran
runners.breeder: Chapel Lane Farm L T D
runners.comment: 20,000euros yearling; tongue-tied for debut, respected from top yard
runners.spotlight: Arizona gelding cost 8,000Euros as a foal and 20,000Euros as a yearling; closely related to three winners inc Preamble (6f 2yo; RPR 88) & Never Rains (1m; 67), half-brother to another; dam unraced, from family of top miler Goldikova; tongue-tied for debut, respected from top yard.

runners.name: Candidly
runners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier
runners.comment: May want a bit further but market strength noted in what appears an ordinary maiden
runners.spotlight: Churchill filly closely related to winners Waver (1m2f-1m4f Flat inc AW, RPR 90; 2m hurdle) and Gold Seal (2m hurdle), half-sister to 11.5f winner Alazne (76); dam Group-placed 1m 2yo winner (92), sister to top-class 2yo/miler Rock Of Gibraltar; blinkered for debut; may want a bit further on breeding but any market strength has to be noted in what appears an ordinary maiden.

runners.name: Chipsrdown
runners.comment: Kodi Bear filly hasn't featured in maidens at Naas and Leopardstown; best watched
runners.spotlight: Kodi Bear filly hasn't featured in maidens at Naas and Leopardstown; best watched.

runners.name: Hugos Girl
runners.comment: Ran well in recent handicap, surprising if she were to play a major role back in maiden
runners.spotlight: Experienced filly pretty exposed although did run well in Curragh handicap recently; surprising if she were to play a major role back in maiden company though.

runners.name: Masked Angel
runners.comment: Comeback run encouraging; senior rider takes over and don't rule out as an each-way play
runners.spotlight: Some promise in AW maidens last autumn and okay comeback run on soft ground at Limerick last month under 7lb claimer; senior rider takes over and don't rule out as an each-way play.

runners.name: Posh Spirit
runners.comment: Unlikely one to make an immediate impact but worth a market check all the same
runners.spotlight: Raven's Pass filly is sister to 6f-8.5f winner Force (inc 2yo/US stakes), half-sister to six winners inc Lady Of Course (Swedish 6f-1m 2yo) and Posh Cracker (1m 2yo; RPR 80); dam US 1m 2yo/1m1f winner, sister to 1m1f Grade 1 winner Rutherienne; unlikely one to make an immediate impact but worth a market check all the same.

runners.name: Tickling
runners.comment: 23,000Euros breeze-up buy; another for whom market best guide on debut
runners.spotlight: Waldgeist filly cost 15,000Euros as a foal and 23,000Euros as a 2yo; half-sister to winners Moyassar (6f inc 2yo/AW; RPR 110), Watch Me (Hungarian 6f) and Kimaya Gold (Italian 6f); dam 6f winner (87), half-sister to 5f 2yo Group 2 winner Sir Prancealot; another for whom market best guide on debut.

runners.name: Winters Breath
runners.breeder: Al Shira'Aa Farms S A R L
runners.comment: Caravaggio filly; yard won this two years ago so newcomer worth a look
runners.spotlight: Caravaggio filly is first foal of a French 5f/5.5f winner (RPR 85), a half-sister to winners Tommy Rock (6f/1m), Madame Plaintiff (7f) and She's Evaporust (French 1m1f 2yo/1m2f); yard won this two years ago so newcomer worth a look.

6:20.race_name: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Race (IRE Incentive Race)

runners.name: Rogue Legend
runners.comment: Ready Cork maiden winner type to keep improving but no easy task conceding lots of weight
runners.spotlight: Havana Grey colt was plenty green when second on Cork debut early this month and returned there a fortnight later, settling better and winning with a fair bit in hand; speedy type and can keep improving, but no easy task conceding plenty of weight.

runners.name: Namiid
runners.comment: Didn't count after a tardy start on debut 10 days ago in good-class Navan maiden
runners.spotlight: Acclamation colt didn't count after a tardy start on debut 10 days ago in good-class Navan maiden; related to some speedy types so don't rule out improvement.

runners.name: Baby Basma
runners.comment: Cork winner greatly respected here with Keane remaining loyal
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to 6f 2yo winner Magic Basma (RPR 86); dam French 5.5f winner (91); won nicely on Cork debut over this trip last month; form not working out that well but still greatly respected here with Keane remaining loyal.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted and Colin said Baby Basma was just a bit frightened when she came out of the stalls, but then settled grand. She had been working brilliantly with nice horses at home and for what she was doing at home as a 2yo, I was fairly confident. The obvious next place is at Naas on May 18 (Coolmore Juvenile Fillies Sprint) or the Marygate Fillies' Stakes at York, so I'll chat with the boss and see what he says - Eoghan O'Neill, trainer.

runners.name: Spring Is Here
runners.comment: Fine debut Curragh Listed run; likely major player
runners.spotlight: Starspangledbanner filly is sister to 2yo Group 3 winner Castle Star ran a fine race on debut in Curragh Listed early this month,  beaten just 2.5l into fourth of 6 behind a subsequent Group 3 winner; likely major player.

runners.name: Pints In Peace
runners.owner: Arvin Savage & Ian Marmion & Justin L Murphy
runners.comment: Definite debut promise at the Curragh; back from a break on quicker ground here
runners.spotlight: Bated Breath colt attracted good market support on opening day of season at the Curragh in late March, showing plenty of promise in finishing a close fourth (second won next time, beating today's rival Rogue Legend, third well held since) on soft; quicker ground here and probably needs to improve a bit to play a major role.

runners.name: Howdyadoit
runners.comment: Respected source but stable jockey prefers Baby Basma
runners.spotlight: From the first crop of Coventry winner Nando Parrado; cost 38,000Euros as a foal; half-brother to winners Tierney (6f 2yo; RPR 86), Tynamite (6f-1m AW; 67), Gadea (Spanish/French 6f inc 2yo) and El Sokhna (Spanish 6f-7.5f); dam 7f/1m winner (inc 2yo; 98); respected source but stable jockey prefers Baby Basma.

runners.name: Lilbittyprettyone
runners.comment: Debutante by leading freshman sire Starman
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam placed 6.5f AW in France, half-sister to French winners No Regrets (7f/1m), Livinginafantasy (1m) and Blue Iris (10.5f), out of French 1m Group 2 winner Lilbittyprettyone (IRE); sire Starman has made a fine start with his first crop.

runners.name: Gelato
runners.comment: Yard does well with sprinting types but this looks a stiff enough task on debut
runners.spotlight: Coulsty filly cost just 1,000Euros as a foal; closely related to 5f 2yo winner Reversion (RPR 75), half-sister to Italian 7.5f 2yo winner Eternal Desire; dam once-raced (52) sister to 6f/7f winner Dutch Destiny; yard does well with sprinting types but this looks a stiff enough task on debut.

runners.name: Igetakickoutofyou
runners.comment: Bungle Inthejungle filly a 5,000Euros yearling; likely all the better for the experience
runners.spotlight: Bungle Inthejungle filly a 5,000Euros yearling; dam placed 7f (2yo) and 1m AW (RPR 59), out of unraced sister to Listed-placed 6f/7f winner Nasri; debutante likely all the better for the experience.

6:50.race_name: It's A Long Way To Being 50 Shane Anderson Maiden

runners.name: Viamonte
runners.comment: Needs to settle better than recent run here; previous Cork effort gives him a big shout
runners.spotlight: Three AW runs over the winter and reappeared with good third in Cork maiden at this trip in April (good); C&D run since not as good, keen and didn't get home; advantage of experience over most of these and sure to be thereabouts if settling better.

runners.name: Melody Bells
runners.comment: Nothing so far in three maiden runs over 7f/1m; big drop in trip here and blinkers tried
runners.spotlight: Nothing so far in three maiden runs over 7f/1m; big drop in trip here and blinkers tried.

runners.name: Best Suggestion
runners.comment: Navan debut run makes him a leading player although sharper 5f may not be ideal
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to winners Giselles Thunder (Listed-placed 5f 2yo; RPR 99) and Cacciante (Italian 6f-7.5f inc Listed 2yo; 97); dam unraced; plenty of debut promise at Navan 10 days ago, keeping on well although lost second late on; not certain this quicker 5f will suit but has to be respected in an ordinary maiden.

runners.name: Fort Star
runners.comment: Two runs last autumn didn't offer a great deal; handicaps likely more his thing
runners.spotlight: Two runs last autumn didn't offer a great deal; handicaps likely more his thing.

runners.name: Hello Silas
runners.comment: Some C&D debut promise but plenty more needed; blinkers added
runners.spotlight: Hello Youmzain colt finished a neck ahead of a below-form Viamonte on C&D debut last month, never getting to leaders when beaten nearly 9l; entitled to come on for that but bred to want further; blinkers now added.

runners.name: Morally Sound
runners.comment: Well held over C&D when keen in first-time blinkers latest; headgear left off here
runners.spotlight: No Nay Never colt cost 150,000gns as a foal and 200,000euros as a yearling; well held in sprint maidens last month at Cork and over C&D when keen in first-time blinkers; headgear left off here.

runners.name: Petersburg
runners.comment: Slowly away, no show on last week's Cork debut; watching brief probably advised for now
runners.spotlight: Sergei Prokofiev gelding fetched 80,000Euros at the breeze-ups; half-brother to Italian 6f winner Bold Grey; slow to break, never counted when well held on debut at Cork a week ago; watching brief probably advised for now.

runners.name: This Aint Texas
runners.comment: Debut promise last year not built on; gelded since and eligible for a mark after this
runners.spotlight: Solid debut effort at Navan a year ago (good) but five months later below that level at Cork; gelded over the winter and eligible for a mark after this.

runners.name: Memphis Rose
runners.comment: Sottsass filly a 20,000gns yearling; newcomer likely all the better for the experience
runners.spotlight: Sottass filly cost 20,000gns as a yearling; closely related to French 6f/6.5f winner Marly (inc 2yo/AW; RPR 96), half-sister to Qatar 8.5f winner Jabahat; dam unraced half-sister to Group-placed 6f/7f winner Omar Bradley; newcomer likely all the better for the experience.

runners.name: Mercury Power
runners.comment: Plenty keen on recent Navan debut and tried hooded now; lots to find with Best Suggestion
runners.spotlight: Third foal; dam 5f winner (RPR 95), half-sister to winners Between Hills (6f 2yo) and Cuppacoffee (5f-7.5f inc 2yo); plenty keen on Navan debut 10 days ago, not knocked about once chance had gone; lots to find with Best Suggestion; tried hooded now.

runners.name: Remarkable News
runners.comment: Some 3.5l to make up on Best Suggestion on Navan form but sharper 5f may suit
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to 1m2f AW 2yo winner Eagles Dare (RPR 68); dam unraced half-sister to Listed winners Malakeh (German 1m) and Smokey Storm (6f 2yo); attracted market support on Navan debut 10 days ago, speed for much of way before tiring when beaten 5.5l; some 3.5l to make up on Best Suggestion but faster 5f may suit so could be closer this time.

runners.name: Shoney
runners.comment: Staying on Sligo second a big player if handling drop in trip
runners.spotlight: Mehmas filly had issues at the start on debut at Dundalk (5f) in February and stepped forward from that at Sligo early this month, keen but staying on into second behind an all-the-way winner over 6f; not sure this drop in trip is ideal but this may not take too much winning.

runners.name: Harrys Hill
runners.comment: Excellent comeback second at Navan; drops in grade and big player
runners.spotlight: Eight-time winner including over C&D as a 5yo, last win coming at Bellewstown last summer; excellent comeback run at Navan 10 days ago when reeling in clear leader late on only to be cut down by a classy sort (Bold Optimist 3l away third); 1lb rise fine and drops in grade here; big player.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Rockingham Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Harry's Hill was disappointing in Tipperary and he was dropped 3lb, we didn't think he would get in. As the week went on we got more positive. We'll see, we might come back next month for the Scurrys - Martin Hassett, trainer

quotes.race: AK Bets "Compare Our Prices To Your Current Bookmaker" Handicap
quotes.quote: Harry's Hill was absolutely buzzing and we had to run despite the ground He had been working with Secret Magician. I'm hoping he'll be okay in the morning - Martin Hassett, trainer.

quotes.race: Follow Tipperaryraces On Facebook Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: It's all about the ground with him Harry's Hill. He's won on soft and we've been running him on fast ground. I knew coming here we'd be some way safe. At this level you have to tick all the boxes. The draw didn't help us but he's tough and genuine - Martin Hassett, trainer.

quotes.race: Find Us On Facebook @dundalkstadium Handicap
quotes.quote: Harry's Hill is a five furlong horse and probably wants soft ground, we thought he would run well. Today was the day - Martin Hassett, trainer

runners.name: Bold Optimist
runners.comment: Has 3l to find with Harry's Hill on Navan run but 5lb better off so place claims
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner has returned with two solid runs this term, at the Curragh and when third at Navan 10 days ago; 3l to find with second-placed Harry's Hill on that run, however, although has been dropped 4lb so can't be ruled out.

runners.name: Emerald Harmony
runners.breeder: B Kennedy & Mrs Ann Marie Kennedy
runners.comment: Below best at Navan last time and good bit to find with Harry's Hill and Bold Optimist
runners.spotlight: Won C&D maiden last summer and scored narrowly at Bellewstown last month off 77; well below best at Navan last time and good bit to find with both Harry's Hill and Bold Optimist.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Emerald Harmony is improving and learning to sprint. The ground was probably as quick as she wanted it but she is going the right way - Ben Coen, rider

runners.name: Fair Taxes
runners.owner: Mrs N Mccreevy & J Mccreevy & P Mccreevy & J Mccreevy

prev_owners.owner: Mrs N McCreevy & J McCreevy & P McCreevy & J McCreevy

runners.comment: Okay runs both starts this term but looks to have a bit to find
runners.spotlight: Prominent-racer whose sole win came over 6f at Fairyhouse last summer; okay runs both starts this term but looks to have a bit to find.

quotes.race: Soil.ie Sobac Healthy Grass Handicap
quotes.quote: Fair Taxes was sharp away and on a straight track you would probably go back to five but around a bend he's okay at six. That was a lovely race in his own age group and we'll try to find something like that again - Ross O'Sullivan, trainer.

runners.name: Sturlasson
runners.comment: Regressive 4yo, well held behind Emerald Harmony at Bellewstown; handicapper relenting
runners.spotlight: Sole victory came when making all in Navan maiden a year ago (5f, good); went close in valuable Epsom sprint in June but has regressed since, well held behind Emerald Harmony at Bellewstown last time; handicapper giving him a chance.

quotes.race: Betfred 3YO "Dash" Handicap
quotes.quote: It was Sturlasson's first time in a handicap, and normally they'd say they need a run in a handicap because it is a different type of sprinting, but he did fantastically well. He won his maiden in Navan, and the thing we were happy with it that the first few furlongs there are a bit undulating and downhill, so he might have had a bit of experience there for this. Oisin [Murphy, jockey] said the three-year-old handicap sprint at Royal Ascot is made for him - that's where he said he'd do, so all things being well, we will. When he first ran in a maiden he was second to Bucanero Fuerte, who is favourite for the Commonwealth Cup, so we knew he was pretty useful - Kieran Cotter, trainer.

quotes.race: Navan Racecourse Maiden
quotes.quote: Sturlasson's work during the week was spectacular. He skipped along there and he loved it. It was a real professional performance and I'm delighted. The lads are saying they might go for the Palace of Holyroodhouse Handicap at Royal Ascot on the Friday - Kieran Cotter, trainer.

runners.name: Mary Shoelaces
runners.comment: Encouraging seasonal return but well held since; hard to be confident in
runners.spotlight: Sole win came at the Curragh last summer (5f, good); very encouraging comeback run over same C&D last month but hasn't backed that up in very competitive handicaps since; hard to be confident in.

runners.name: Sarahmae
runners.owner: Mary B Hogan & Michael M Obrien
runners.comment: C&D winner last month; did well last time after blowing start; could have more to offer
runners.spotlight: Improved since being dropped to 5f, winning over C&D last month off 61, better again when close fourth at Naas; did well considering she blew that start at Cork (under 7lb claimer) on latest and quite likely she has more to offer with senior rider back aboard.

runners.name: My Girl Sioux
runners.comment: Hard to win with but holding her form well of late in busy campaign; respected
runners.spotlight: Just 1-47 but has been in good form of late in a busy campaign, going close at both Naas and Navan; left with fair bit to do from a high draw at Cork last time but remains a threat on overall profile.

runners.name: Beano Power
runners.comment: Navan winner on soft, ground possibly too quick at Naas; rain will suit
runners.spotlight: Improving 4yo filly got off the mark on turf return over this trip at Navan last month off 53 on soft; unable to land a telling blow on quicker ground at Naas since so predicted rain will suit; 1lb wrong.

runners.name: Art Of Unity
runners.comment: Better for last week's comeback run; stiff task from 7lb out of handicap in a better grade
runners.spotlight: Gained two 5f wins with cut in the ground at the back end of last term although has previous winning form on good; possibly needed comeback run and yard debut at Cork last week but stiff task from 7lb out of handicap here in a better grade.

quotes.race: Troytown Bar Handicap
quotes.quote: He was very brave today and tried very hard. I told Leigh to bounce out and make every post a winning one. Art Of Unity skipped along and you could see him putting his old ears back in the last 100 yards. He tried his heart out. He had 8-6 there and Leigh is a good, strong rider. Leigh and Gary Halpin suit him as they are strong riders but unfortunately Gary couldn't do the weight today and Leigh was a good deputy. He'll go for the Joe McGrath at the Curragh now - Johnny Feane, trainer.

quotes.race: TRI Equestrian Handicap
quotes.quote: Art Of Unity got a nice easy lead and the tailwind helped him, as did the conditions - John Feane, trainer.

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Nursery Handicap (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: He ran well the other day and was a little unlucky in getting lonesome on ground that probably was as slow as he wanted. Back to the five furlong trip here was ideal. He had a nice draw, handled the surface well and is a horse who probably doesn't really know how to sprint yet, as he was a little bit lost early doors. He'd probably be a nice little sprinter for Noel next year during the summer on good ground and they should have plenty of fun with him - Colin Keane, jockey

runners.name: Albert Hirsch
runners.owner: Ms R Walshe & A Gleeson & M Mcevoy & J Whittle
runners.comment: Well held in three bumpers before an 11l sixth in a 1m6f maiden at Gowran in September
runners.spotlight: Well held in three bumpers before an 11l sixth in a 1m6f maiden at Gowran in September; opposable.

runners.name: Captain Hanley
runners.comment: Midfield in an AW maiden but then beaten some 25l over 1m1f at Ballinrobe
runners.spotlight: Midfield in a 1m2f AW maiden before moving yards and then beaten 25l over 1m1f at Ballinrobe; now tongue tied.

runners.name: Ceol Draiochta
runners.comment: 108-rated hurdler after six starts in that discipline; wouldn't be the obvious answer
runners.spotlight: 108-rated hurdler after six starts in that discipline; wouldn't be the obvious answer to a 1m4f maiden.

runners.name: Delta Force
runners.comment: Galway bumper winner with a record of 1-5 in that scene; others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Had five runs in bumpers, winning on good ground at Galway last summer before a 10l third here; might be vulnerable in a race of this nature.

runners.name: Factual Fact
runners.comment: Over two years since he ran away with a soft-ground bumper at Thurles
runners.spotlight: Over two years since he ran away with a soft-ground bumper at Thurles and seemed well regarded back then; the market should be instructive on this belated return and Flat debut.

quotes.race: www.thurlesraces.ie (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Factual Fact put up a smart performance. Henry told me to drop him in and ride him with plenty of confidence and I thought he was impressive. He has plenty of speed and he will come on a pile for that - John Gleeson, rider.

runners.name: Moment Of Prayer
runners.comment: Tailed off in a bumper and was 150-1 when departing early on hurdling debut
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in a bumper and was 150-1 when departing early on hurdling debut (hood tried there now dispensed with); limited appeal.

runners.name: Whosethebestboy
runners.breeder: Airlie Stud & Mrs S M Rogers
runners.comment: Weak 25-1 chance when comfortably beaten in a Fairyhouse bumper in November
runners.spotlight: Weak 25-1 chance when comfortably beaten in a Fairyhouse bumper in November.

runners.name: Light Up The Dark
runners.comment: Listed bumper winner; seemed to find 1m1f too sharp on Flat debut; can improve
runners.spotlight: Won both her bumpers, the latest a Listed race on soft ground in March (other win was on heavy); beaten 13l on Flat debut at Ballinrobe but made some late gains and she's up in distance here from 1m1f.

runners.name: Liss Eile
runners.comment: Showed a bit in bumpers but has been well held in her two Flat races (1m2f/1m6f)
runners.spotlight: Showed a bit in bumpers but has been well held in her two Flat races (1m2f/1m6f).

runners.name: Ardashir
runners.breeder: Stratford Place Stud & Willow Bloodstock Ltd
runners.comment: 120,000euros yearling; half-brother to 1m winner Tulekya (RPR 84)
runners.spotlight: 120,000euros yearling; half-brother to 1m winner Tulekya (RPR 84); dam German 8.7f winner; needs checking in the betting.

runners.name: Jr Mahon
runners.comment: Beaten in the region of 7l in 1m2f/1m4f maidens at Leopardstown on good ground
runners.spotlight: Beaten in the region of 7l in 1m2f/1m4f maidens at Leopardstown on good ground; both races were won by Ballydoyle and this looks easier; cheekpieces added.
