stable_tour.quote: He had a lovely debut at Leopardstown and the penny only dropped inside the last furlong and a half. He ran through the line really well. He was entered at Tipperary on Thursday but that was just coming a little bit quick, so we'll wait for Navan in a fortnight. He's going to be a lovely middle-distance type. He reminds me an awful lot of Kinesiology last year. 23-04-25

runners.name: Kasgani
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: Pleasing second run when coming from off the pace in a steadily-run maiden at Leopardstown
runners.spotlight: By Sea The Stars out of a smart long-distance mare; encouraging second run when coming from off the pace in a steadily-run maiden at Leopardstown and was just in front of Jr Mahon who was ridden handier; good chance.

runners.name: Kilmeaden
runners.comment: His second at Ballinrobe has since been franked and this colt is in the Irish Derby
runners.spotlight: Finished ahead of Kasgani on debut and was then clear of the remainder when second at Ballinrobe (1m5f, good) behind a Twomey newcomer who has since won a Listed race; has an Irish Derby entry and should hold every chance.

runners.name: Pharos Freedom
runners.comment: 180,000euros yearling; second foal out of a Galileo mare who was placed at 1m4f
runners.spotlight: 180,000euros yearling; second foal out of a Galileo mare who was placed at 1m4f; debut has been a while coming and immediately fitted with headgear, but given the yard he'd be of serious interest if strong in the market.

runners.name: Synchronize
runners.comment: Ex-Gosden; some promise to take from latest run in a maiden hurdle; handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Soon shipped out of the Gosden yard after heavy defeats but some promise to take from latest run in a maiden hurdle; handicap debut.

runners.name: Tassarolo
runners.comment: Placed in latest maiden hurdle; this trip a better fit than on his handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Beaten about 10l in only previous Flat handicap on the AW (1m); this could be more his trip and was placed in a maiden hurdle two weeks ago; cheekpieces added.

runners.name: Billie Frechette
runners.comment: Four runs good under both codes this year, winning a 2m handicap on the AW
runners.spotlight: Four good runs under both codes this year, winning a 2m handicap on the AW; then 2l away over 1m6f at Navan before a near miss over hurdles; good chance.

runners.name: Plunkett Street
runners.comment: Back from a break to win narrowly over 1m4f at Cork and 5lb rise not the end of the world
runners.spotlight: Back from a break to win narrowly over 1m4f at Cork (soft) and a 5lb rise isn't the end of the world; solid prospects.

runners.name: Fascinating Shadow

prev_owners.owner: Townley Hall Bloodstock And D J Cox

runners.comment: Has a 6lb pull with Plunkett Street on their recent Cork clash (3.25l between them)
runners.spotlight: Turf/AW/hurdle winner; has a 6lb pull with Plunkett Street on their recent Cork clash (3.25l between them) and has since performed respectably over hurdles; each-way claims.

quotes.race: Sign Up To Our Newsletter Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I think Fascinating Shadow is a nice horse. He does everything right for me at home. We went to Dundalk with him, my first runner there in eight years, but I went up with him, and ever since he scored there the plan was to come here. He probably want nearly faster ground than that, but he'll be a nice novice horse for the year - Shark Hanlon, trainer.

runners.name: My Minervina
runners.comment: Three-time winner but left Peter Fahey in poor form and has been off for a year
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner but left Peter Fahey in poor form and has been off for a year.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies & Mares Handicap
quotes.quote: My Minervina seems better going left-handed. She doesn't seem to act going the other way. She's in again on Saturday at Killarney and she will probably run again - Shane Foley, rider.

runners.name: Serotonin
runners.comment: Modest Flat form; last seen 11 months ago when tailed off over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Ran well in a 1m2f maiden at Sligo two years ago but modest Flat form otherwise; last seen 11 months ago when tailed off over hurdles.

runners.name: Beer With The Boys
runners.comment: Quite keen on his return from an absence at Sligo (1m5f, good) so did well to be placed
runners.spotlight: Dual Flat winner; quite keen on his return from an absence at Sligo (1m5f, good) so did well to be placed; can improve on that.

quotes.race: Racing UK On Sky Channel 426 Maiden Stakes (Div II)
quotes.quote: Beer With The Boys jumped well and travelled nicely through the race. He stayed on well in the home straight and won quite cosily - Andrea Atzeni, jockey.

runners.name: Young Lucy
runners.comment: Running well over hurdles until last time; has hinted at winning potential on the Flat
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in her final handicap hurdle but had been running well in that scene, including a second at Cheltenham last November; has hinted at winning potential on the Flat.

runners.name: Noble Andy
runners.comment: Placed last season but good way behind Plunkett Street at Cork a month ago; now blinkered
runners.spotlight: Placed last season but was a good way behind Plunkett Street at Cork a month ago; now in blinkers.

runners.name: Slieve Bearnagh
runners.comment: Nicely clear of the rest when just missing out at Limerick a month ago
runners.spotlight: Has won under both codes and was nicely clear of the rest when just missing out at Limerick a month ago (1m4f, soft to heavy); goes on all ground; considered.

quotes.race: Mallow Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Slieve Bearnagh got into a lovely rhythm out in front and Josh made use of his jumping. The horse will mix it with the Flat - Michael Halford, co-trainer.

runners.name: Spanish John
runners.comment: 0-9 on the Flat and no placed form either; inferior hurdler to some of these as well
runners.spotlight: 0-9 on the Flat and no placed form either; inferior hurdler to some of these as well.

quotes.race: Broderick's Electric Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I didn't expect it. I rode Spanish John work lately, he was quite raw and he still was today. He had plenty left - Michael O'Sullivan, jockey.

runners.name: Lord Talbot
runners.owner: Elaine Shevlin & David Boylan & Ms Denise Mccourt
runners.comment: His 1m2f handicap win at Dundalk last winter is a bit of a standout
runners.spotlight: His 1m2f handicap win at Dundalk last winter is a bit of a standout; balance of form leaves him with a good bit to prove.

runners.name: Randall Poets Lass
runners.comment: Hasn't really kicked on from her early promise in turf maidens; off since early March

stable_tour.quote: Of all my juveniles this colt has probably done the most work as he is so straightforward and physically in a good place. He will want 6f to start off and I would think he will be ready to run a big race first time out. He will run before Royal Ascot and that will tell us whether he is good enough for that royal meeting. 21-04-21

runners.name: Devasboy
runners.comment: Arrives in decent nick, a close fifth in Brighton handicap six days ago; one to consider

runners.name: Dumfries
runners.owner: Buist, Shields, Thompson And Mrs R Carr
runners.comment: Won at Thirsk and not disgraced given raced wide when sixth at Wolver since; can go well
runners.spotlight: Resumed winning ways at Thirsk (7f) in April and not disgraced given he raced wide when sixth of 11 in 7f Wolverhampton handicap 15 days ago; can go well.

stable_tour.quote: He was a winner of a Southwell maiden for Marcus Tregoning and he ran well back there for us first time this season, where he wasn't beaten too far. He's a miler. I can't find anything for him back at Southwell, so I'm hoping the ground has dried up a bit for him at Pontefract on April 22. 17-04-24

runners.name: Dashing Donkey

runners.name: Al Shabab
runners.comment: Ninth at Wolver 15 days ago; possibilities from an easing mark with visor now refitted

runners.name: Bibendum
runners.owner: New Vision Bloodstock And Miss J R Macey

runners.name: Sunday Belle
runners.comment: Off 16 months before beating one home at Nottingham 18 days ago; much more is required
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo has shown only poor form to date, off 16 months before beating just one home on her handicap debut at Nottingham (1m) 18 days ago; much more is required.

runners.name: Hawk Jet
runners.comment: Last of eight in 11.5f Bath handicap 13 days ago; easy to look elsewhere
runners.spotlight: Still to get her head in front and she came in last of eight in 11.5f Bath handicap 13 days ago; easy to look elsewhere.

runners.name: Ajrad
runners.comment: Scored at Wolverhampton (7f) in January but he's been largely below par since
runners.spotlight: Scored at Wolverhampton (7f) in January but he's been largely below par since, fifth of 14 in 7f Chepstow handicap two weeks ago; not the most reliable.

stable_tour.quote: He's only just joined us- he's a horse who appeared to be hard to win with and the owners sent him to us for a change of scenery. We've only had him a few weeks and so it'll be interesting how we'll get on with him. He's a 7f-1m horse. 11-07-24

runners.name: Shark Two One

prev_owners.owner: New Vision Bloodstock And Miss J R Macey

runners.comment: It's now 17 starts since he went in over C&D in 2023; others appeal more
runners.spotlight: It's now 17 starts since he went in over C&D in 2023 and he came in a below-form seventh of 11 over 6f here last month; cheekpieces replace usual blinkers but others appeal more.

quotes.race: Tattersalls Ireland Super Auction Sale Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Shark Two One is a lovely little horse. I probably got there soon enough but he quickened up well and was maybe getting a bit lonely going to the line - Colin Keane, rider

runners.name: Honrado
runners.breeder: Lofts Hall Stud & Mrs C R Philipson

prev_owners.owner: Oti Racing, Lofts Hall Stud & Partner

runners.comment: Beat just one home at Brighton 19 days ago; drops markedly in trip with lots to prove
runners.spotlight: Seems a poor maiden nowadays and he beat just one home in 1m4f Brighton handicap 19 days ago; drops markedly in trip with lots to prove.

runners.name: Fast Flo
runners.comment: Longstanding maiden; hard to make a case for
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden who beat only two home in 6f Redcar handicap last month; hard to make a case for.

runners.name: Wild Eyed Girl
runners.comment: Offered little in two runs for current yard either side of Christmas; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Yet to get her head in front and she offered little in two runs for her current yard either side of Christmas; others are much preferred.

runners.name: Tilsworth Silver
runners.comment: Has beaten just one rival in three starts in 2025; very hard to make a case for
runners.spotlight: Has beaten just one rival in three starts in 2025; very hard to make a case for.

runners.name: Toota
runners.comment: Looked rusty after nine months off af Ripon on her return; can take a step forward
runners.spotlight: Sands Of Mali filly ended 2024 in good form without winning and she looked rusty after nine months off when beating one home in 6f Ripon handicap last month; can take a step forward.

runners.name: Freedom Bay

runners.spotlight: Brought along steadily as 2yo and she made a promising start to life in handicaps when fourth of nine at Wolverhampton (7f) 29 days ago, running on well late from a wide draw; has more to offer and is a big player.

runners.name: Dynamite Diva
runners.comment: Failed to make frame in five runs as a juvenile; needs yard switch to spark improvement
runners.spotlight: Failed to make the frame in five runs as a juvenile, coming in tenth of 12 in 1m Bath nursery on her final run for Rod Millman; needs this yard switch to spark improvement; cheekpieces added.

runners.name: California Fling
runners.comment: Fair sixth at Wolver 29 days ago; needs to build on it on her turf debut

runners.name: Kilteel

stable_tour.quote: She's probably not very posh but she's quite a talented filly. She won a nursery at Newcastle last year and then disappointed a little bit, but she's well handicapped. She goes to Chelmsford on Thursday. 30-04-25

runners.name: Me Tarzan

runners.name: Spuddling
runners.comment: Fair fifth at Lingfield in January; more is required after a break to gain a first win
runners.spotlight: Only modest form to date and came in just a fair fifth of eight in 1m AW Lingfield handicap when last seen in January; more is required after a break if he's to gain a first victory.

runners.name: Camden Flyer
runners.comment: 0-9 and she beat only one home in 7f Chelmsford handicap in February
runners.spotlight: 0-9 and beat only one home in 7f Chelmsford handicap in February; needs plenty more returning after a break.

runners.name: Desert Beauty
runners.comment: Best run when third at Bath 27 days ago; form franked so she's very much one to consider
runners.spotlight: Oasis Dream filly took a big step forward on her first go in handicaps when third of seven at Bath (1m) 27 days ago; that form has been franked so she's very much one to consider with further progress on the cards.

runners.name: Cider Bob
runners.comment: Only seventh of eight on handicap debut at Southwell 27 days ago; lots more is required
runners.spotlight: Just poor form shown to date and came in only seventh of eight on handicap debut at Southwell (7f) 27 days ago; lots more is required.

runners.name: Sir Kenny

runners.comment: Has offered little in his four runs; a hood is reached for now with plenty to find

runners.spotlight: Landed a 5.5f claimer in Le Croise-Laroche in France in September, but she showed little in a pair of 7f AW novices for her current yard in December; needs this switch to handicaps to spark a resurgence.

runners.name: Crimson Lad
runners.owner: Steel A Win And Miss J Macey
runners.comment: Beat only one home in 7f Chelmsford handicap 26 days ago; others are much preferred
runners.spotlight: Poor maiden who beat only one home in 7f Chelmsford handicap 26 days ago; others are much preferred.

runners.breeder: Mrs D Joly, D Powell & A Richardson

runners.spotlight: Not disgraced when fourth of eight in 7f Kempton handicap 22 days ago; visor replaces usual cheekpieces but with more needed if she's to gain a first victory at the 12th attempt.

2:20.race_name: racingtv.com EBF Restricted Maiden Fillies' Stakes (Bands C & D) (Qual') (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)

runners.name: Bleep Test
runners.comment: Promising 2nd to useful sort on debut here; 6f likely to suit and looks the one to beat
runners.spotlight: Filly by Time Test; 1,000gns foal; half-sister to two winners; promising 2l second to a subsequent hat-trick scorer in a 5f novice here on debut (good, third won next time in France); 6f should suit; stable has some decent juveniles and looks the one to beat.

runners.name: Calypso Breeze
runners.comment: By A'Ali; half-sister to Italian 5f-1m winner; likely to improve for the experience
runners.spotlight: By A'Ali; 24,000gns yearling; half-sister to Italian 5f-1m winner; makes debut and is likely to improve for the experience.

runners.name: Going Again
runners.comment: 42,000gns yearling; dam 6f AW winner as a juvenile; worth a market check on debut.
runners.spotlight: By Acclamation; 42,000gns yearling; £32,000 buy back at the breeze-up; dam 6f AW winner as a juvenile; worth a market check on debut.

runners.name: Hamaleel
runners.comment: Half-sister to a 5f winner; dam 5f 2yo winner; likely sort; worth a market check on debut
runners.spotlight: By top miler Palace Pier; half-sister to a 5f winner; dam 5f 2yo winner on only start; interesting newcomer who is worth a market check.

runners.name: Lina Codina
runners.comment: Not disgraced when 7l eighth of 11 in York novice on debut; should improve for the run
runners.spotlight: 32,000gns breeze-up buy; never featured but wasn't disgraced when 7l eighth of 11 in York novice on debut (6f, good to firm; 250-1); should improve for the experience.

runners.name: Lovethiswayagain
runners.owner: Mrs Paul Shanahan & Mrs M V Magnier
runners.comment: 22-1 when third of four on Salisbury debut (form nothing special); 6f should suit
runners.spotlight: 35,000euros yearling by No Nay Never; half-sister to three winners at up to a mile; 2.75l third of four in a Salisbury novice on debut (5f, good to firm; 22-1); the runner-up has since been well beaten on the AW, so the form may not be anything out of the ordinary; 6f should suit and well drawn.

runners.name: Monks Hill
runners.owner: Alfa Site Services Ltd & Graeme Curnow
runners.comment: Half-sister to a 7f AW winner; dam French Listed-placed 2yo; may need the run on debut
runners.spotlight: 33,000euros yearling by Dandy Man; third foal; half-sister to a 7f AW winner; dam French Listed-placed at 7f as a 2yo; likely to improve for the run.

runners.name: Rivera Queen
runners.owner: D Macauliffe, A Don & J Joyce
runners.comment: Bred to be a speedy juvenile so worth a market check

runners.name: Sandy Craic
runners.comment: 30,000gns yearling; half-sister to a very useful 6f/7f winner; interesting newcomer
runners.spotlight: 30,000gns yearling by Starman; half-sister to a very useful 6f/7f winner; dam Listed-placed 7f-1m2f winner; interesting newcomer from a stable going well.

runners.name: Harswell River

runners.spotlight: Filly by Rover Boyne (juvevile/Group 1 winner in USA): well beaten seventh of ten in Thirsk novice on debut (5f, good; 80-1); improvement needed.

runners.name: Homestrait
runners.comment: Second twice over 5f at Beverley; shapes as though 6f will suit; each-way chance
runners.spotlight: Badly drawn when runner-up in two 5f races on good to firm at Beverley; shapes as though the step up to 6f will suit; each-way chance.

runners.name: Muddy Nora
runners.comment: Well behind Bleep Test when 11l ninth of ten in a 5f novice here on debut; more needed
runners.spotlight: Well behind Bleep Test when 11l ninth of ten in a 5f novice here on debut (good); significant improvement needed.

runners.name: Princess Amna
runners.comment: Fourth foal of a 1m4f AW winner who cost 1,800gns; likely to need further in time.
runners.spotlight: Filly by Earthlight; 1,800gns yearling; fourth foal of a 1m4f AW winner; not an obvious one on breeding and likely to need further in time.

runners.name: U Heat
runners.comment: Half-sister to Italian 1m-10.5f winner; likely to improve for the experience.
runners.spotlight: Fifth foal; half-sister to Italian 1m-10.5f winner; dam unplaced 5f-1m2f; likely to improve for the experience.

runners.name: Requiem
runners.comment: Improved in h'caps this term, best run when 2nd over 1m3f latest; 1m6f may suit; contender
runners.spotlight: Typical Prescott 3yo who has improved for the step up in trip and handicaps (also a gelding operation) this season; improved on his handicap debut over 1m2f when 1.75l second of seven at Haydock last time (1m3.5f, good to firm); could progress again over 1m6f and he's a key player.

runners.name: Maywedance
runners.comment: Last of four over 11.5f latest (3rd has won since); first run at 1m6f; interesting
runners.spotlight: Best run as a juvenile when runner-up over 7.5f at Beverley in September (good); last of four when tried over 11.5f at Windsor last time, but was beaten only 2.25l and the third has since won at Bath; up in trip again with cheekpieces tried; interesting.

runners.name: Brave Emerald
runners.comment: Third in a maiden over 1m4f on 2nd start; poor last time; chance up to 1m6f on h'cap debut
runners.spotlight: Unexposed; best run so far when third to a subsequent winner in a 1m4f Catterick maiden in April (good to firm); well below that form last time, but interesting up in trip on handicap debut.

runners.name: Rommie The Miracle
runners.comment: Best run when third over 1m4f at Beverley last time; 1m6f should suit; could go well
runners.spotlight: Best run so far when 1.75l third to a stable companion of Requiem in a 1m4f handicap at Beverley last time (good to firm); likely to fare even better at 1m6f; could go well.

runners.name: Captain Brett
runners.breeder: Mountain View Stud & J C B/Stock
runners.comment: Improved in handicaps this term but didn't look easy when head 2nd on AW latest; possible
runners.spotlight: Has improved for stepping up in trip in handicaps this season, although didn't look straightforward when head runner-up to an improver at Kempton last time (1m4f, standard to slow; first two clear) when his rider reported he hung both ways and ran too freely; may improve again at 1m6f; a possible if as effective back on grass.

runners.name: Max The Tiger
runners.comment: Best run 2nd last time but not sure to confirm form with third-placed Rommie The Miracle
runners.spotlight: Showed improved form when second to a stable companion of Requiem in a 1m4f handicap at Beverley last time (good to firm) when Rommie the Miracle was a nose behind in third but is now 2lb better off; 2lb out of the handicap; each-way chance.
