runners.name: Bernalda
runners.comment: Below best from wide draw on reappearance but no surprise should she fare better over 1m2f
runners.spotlight: Below best after five-month break from wide draw at Thirsk but should come on for that and, although yet to win, she's shown enough to suggest she's a player over a trip she's bred to stay.

runners.name: Kaaress
runners.comment: Exposed sort but running creditably this season and should give a good account
runners.spotlight: Triple AW winner whose turf win came over this C&D (on soft); respectable efforts on a sound surface this season and, although exposed, she'll likely give another good account.

runners.name: Naturalia
runners.comment: 1m1f soft-ground winner last year but below best last three starts, including reappearance
runners.spotlight: 1m1f soft-ground winner last year but below best on last three starts, including on reappearance at Hamilton this month; needs to step up a fair way if she's to figure.

runners.name: Spirit Of The Bay
runners.comment: Infrequent winner of late but shaped well on reappearance; not certain to back that up
runners.spotlight: Only one win (in 2023) since 2021 but has slipped in the weights and shaped well on reappearance; record suggests she's not guaranteed to back that up this time, though.

stable_tour.quote: Her comeback fourth at Kempton ranks as one of her better performances even though she didn't win. It came in better company and we'll explore a mile and a quarter. She gave her owners heaps of fun last year and she's unexposed over further, which might balance out the fact she's rated higher. 21-04-22

This filly hadawonderfully productive summer last year, winning four on the bounce over a mile, but in so doing saw her mark rise from 63 to 83. I thought she put upacareer-best performance at Ascot last month when a head  second, again over a mile, and she's gone up 3lb to a new high of 86. I always felt she would get further and we'll try that at some point. I'm not too sure where she goes next as she doesn't appreciate the ground being too firm. 09-06-22

runners.name: Jet Black
runners.breeder: Team Valor, Cayton Park Stud, Cad Racing
runners.owner: Team Valor, Cayton Park Stud, A Singh
runners.comment: Improved when upped to 1m2f on handicap debut (form franked) last time; leading claims
runners.spotlight: Improved form when upped to 1m2f on handicap debut at Nottingham this month, a race in which she finished ahead of subsequent dual winner Phaedra; big chance from 1lb higher.

runners.name: Shielas Well
runners.comment: Dual winner over 1m last September but below that level over middle distances this year
runners.spotlight: Dual 1m winner last September but no improvement since being upped in trip this year; disappointed at Beverley and others make more appeal.

3:20.race_name: Watch Irish Racing On Racing TV Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Mazza
runners.comment: Always behind over 1m at Wetherby last month on belated debut
runners.spotlight: Slowly away and always behind in 1m contest at Wetherby last month on belated debut, achieving very little.

runners.name: Mr Withington
runners.breeder: S A S Haras Le Gue
runners.comment: Modest sixth in 7f AW event in sole run for Roger Teal
runners.spotlight: Modest sixth at Southwell (7f, AW) in sole run for Roger Teal; this 4yo has plenty to find on the figures, upped in trip.

runners.name: Burj Zabeel
runners.comment: Nicely bred; promising fourth at Windsor where he was the sole newcomer; interesting
runners.spotlight: Nicely bred colt who showed clear promise with his fourth-place finish at Windsor (1m2f, good to firm) where he was the sole newcomer in a field of nine; interesting with progress on the cards.

runners.name: Dragon Warrior
runners.comment: 58,000gns yearling; pedigree suggests he's potentially useful
runners.spotlight: 58,000gns yearling; by Churchill; sibling to six winners, notably Talbeyah (8.5f-1m2f including Canada; 99) and Sarrocchi (7f 2yo/1m Listed; RPR 98); dam French/US 7.5f/1m winner (including Listed; 103); debutant who looks potentially useful.

runners.name: Without Burlington

prev_owners.owner: Ms L G Robinson, J D Gunther & Partners

runners.comment: Well-held third over C&D last time but the first two have boosted the form since
runners.spotlight: Beaten about 14l in both starts but certainly showed some promise with his third-place finish over C&D (good) latest and the first two have performed well in notable races since; may improve.

runners.name: Mafting
runners.comment: Clear second in two middle-distance events, beaten only a short head latest; the form pick
runners.spotlight: Looks a winner waiting to happen, having finished a clear second in middle-distance events at Beverley (good) and Hamilton (good to firm), beaten only a short head latest; started favourite both times; the form pick.

runners.name: War Supremo
runners.comment: Solid third upped to 1m2f in latest AW run; possibilities kept to this trip on turf debut
runners.spotlight: Raced only on AW; seemed to find 6f/7f inadequate last year and duly showed improvement with solid third upped to 1m2f at Chelmsford on reappearance; possibilities kept to this trip on turf debut.

runners.name: Bin Ajwad
runners.comment: One of the main form contenders and helps to give his owner a solid hand
runners.spotlight: Similar efforts at Newcastle (7f, AW) and Ayr (1m, good), keeping on and making the frame both times; one of the main form contenders upped further in distance and helps to give his owner a solid hand.

runners.name: Sidney Stratton
runners.comment: Poor claims on his 2yo efforts over 7f
runners.spotlight: Seasonal debutant who has poor claims on his 2yo efforts over 7f; gelded since last run.

runners.name: Celestial Odyssey
runners.comment: Only sixth of seven, beaten about 6l, in 1m AW maiden at Newcastle
runners.spotlight: Ulysses filly; only sixth of seven, beaten about 6l, in 1m AW maiden at Newcastle having been easy to back; however, may do better with the outing/experience under her belt.

runners.name: Suite Antique
runners.comment: 33,000gns yearling; Sottsass half-sister to two winners
runners.spotlight: 33,000gns yearling; Sottsass half-sister to winners Rogue Force (7f/1m AW; RPR 82) and Emily's Eclipse (7.4f 2yo; 75); less interesting than the other newcomer; market may complete the picture.

runners.name: Misemerald
runners.comment: 0-11 in handicaps but nearly put that right when upped to 1m last time; possibilities
runners.spotlight: Registered maiden/novice wins as a 2yo; 0-11 in handicaps but nearly put that right when upped to 1m and dropped to Class 6 at Nottingham most recently; possibilities.

runners.name: Snapcracklepop
runners.comment: Record of 3-26 for the Muir/Grassick yard; makes stable/seasonal debut
runners.spotlight: Record of 3-26 for the Muir/Grassick yard, the most recent win over 1m2f last June; drops back in trip on stable/seasonal debut; market may prove best guide to expectations.

stable_tour.quote: He made a winning seasonal debut at Nottingham in his first handicap, over 1m½f, and followed up with a good second at Doncaster. At Sandown early this month William [Buick] thought he was going to win in the straight but he didn't find what William felt he had and came home fourth. The winner of that race has gone in again, so it was a stronger race than we first thought, and Snapcracklepop backed that up by winning at Windsor on Saturday. 01-09-22

runners.name: Volenti
runners.comment: Most wins on Newcastle AW; nearly three years since sole turf success
runners.spotlight: Has gained most wins on Newcastle AW; always behind when returned to turf last time and it's nearly three years since sole success in this sphere; others preferred.

runners.name: Barleybrown
runners.comment: Very similar type to Volenti, having done most of his winning at Newcastle
runners.spotlight: Very similar type to Volenti, having done most of his winning on Newcastle Tapeta; gained sole turf success in 2023 and is now 16lb higher; difficult task back in this sphere.

stable_tour.quote: Last year was a good one for him with four wins, all at Newcastle over a mile. He had a busy time of it and has had aeak since December. He'll need to improve a bit this year because he's risen to a mark of 66. He needs to be held up. 09-04-25

runners.name: Poets Dawn
runners.breeder: Mrs J K Powell & Catridge Farm Stud
runners.comment: Veteran who is running into form; multiple winner, including over C&D off 3lb higher
runners.spotlight: Veteran who is running in to form, having made the frame at Ripon (1m2f) in last two starts; multiple winner down the years, including over C&D off 3lb higher; not ruled out.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Handicap
quotes.quote: It felt like the leader was getting away but Poet's Dawn has a big heart and he dug deep. He's a grand horse to have in the yard, he goes on any ground and very versatile - David Allan, jockey.

quotes.race: Ice Co Supporting Macmillan Handicap
quotes.quote: Poet's Dawn slipped coming out the stalls at Beverley last time and couldn't get in the race. He loves a bit of cut in the ground and David said he seemed to go better left-handed than right - Tim Easterby, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing UK In Glorious HD Novice Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: The race that Poet's Dawn ran in at Redcar last time worked out quite well with several winners coming out of it, and this didn't look a particularly good race - Tim Easterby, trainer.

runners.name: Evelyns Phoenix
runners.comment: Scored three times last term; failed to beat a rival on reappearance; 1-1 here
runners.spotlight: Scored three times in his first season last year; dropped away and failed to beat a rival on reappearance but may fare better with that outing under his belt; 1-1 at Redcar.

runners.name: See Paris
runners.owner: James Paul Services To Industry Ltd
runners.comment: Ex-German; far from solid on his British form
runners.spotlight: Two wins in Germany; far from solid on his British form and is best watched unless the market suggests otherwise.

runners.name: Northern Cracksman
runners.comment: Likely player on the pick of his 2025 AW form, which includes two wins
runners.spotlight: Record of 0-4 on turf but is a likely player on the pick of his 2025 AW form, which includes wins in last two runs for Lawrence Mullaney; has rejoined that yard since last start.

quotes.race: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Handicap
quotes.quote: Lawrence [Mullaney, trainer] has done a great job with Northern Cracksman and he did it nicely. Going in the gates later helped him as he can be a bit restless in there but he got away nice and it was smooth sailing from then on - Billy Loughnane, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Electric Avenue
runners.comment: Inconsistent results this year but current mark gives her a fighting chance
runners.spotlight: Successful on turf (off just 1lb lower) last June and on AW (off this mark) in December; inconsistent results this year but holds a good chance if running to her best.

runners.name: Cuban Fiesta
runners.comment: In good form on Newcastle AW for new stable and opened his account last time
runners.spotlight: In good form at Newcastle (1m, AW) this season for new stable and gamely opened his account last time; may remain competitive, having gone back up just 2lb.

runners.name: Ratafia
runners.comment: Course scorer; comes with a ground proviso, with good to firm a likely negative
runners.spotlight: Course scorer who is on a handy mark but comes with a ground proviso, with good to firm a likely negative; registered his turf wins on heavy and good to soft.

quotes.race: Gary Wilson 65th Birthday Celebration Handicap
quotes.quote: Ratafia needed every inch of that and the heavy ground was a bonus. He's taken time to come to himself, but soft ground looks the key to him - Joanna Mason, jockey.

runners.name: Ravishing Beauty
runners.comment: Maiden who has some encouraging form; stone below opening mark; could go well
runners.spotlight: Sole maiden in this field but has bits of encouraging form and is now a stone below her opening mark; the 1m2f trip excuses latest effort; could go well.

5:25.race_name: Watch Race Replays On Racing TV Amateur Jockeys' Handicap

runners.name: Prince Of Bel Lir
runners.comment: Record of 6-44 for Joseph Parr; check the market signals on debut for new yard
runners.spotlight: Record of 6-44 for Joseph Parr, the most recent win on AW in January; hasn't scored on turf since 2023 but market support should be heeded on debut for new yard.

quotes.race: Cazoo Handicap
quotes.quote: Prince Of Bel Lir enjoyed this ground better than he did at Thirsk last time and hopefully he can build on this - Daniel Muscutt, rider.

runners.name: Four Adaay
runners.comment: Some respectable efforts this year, while edging down the weights; not dismissed
runners.spotlight: Strike-rate is 7-62, the most recent win last September; some respectable efforts this year, while edging down the weights; not dismissed off current mark in this grade.

stable_tour.quote: She's been a bit out of sorts but has become very well-handicapped. She was a very unlucky loser last month at Nottingham where she got in a bit of trouble, so she should pick up a few races between now and the end of the season. 11-07-24

runners.name: So Grateful
runners.owner: The Mick & David Easterby Racing Group
runners.comment: Made all at Thirsk ten days ago; has plenty of form under Serena Brotherton
runners.spotlight: Made all at Thirsk (6f, good to firm) ten days ago, taking record to 6-57; has plenty of form under Serena Brotherton, including a second-place finish in this race in 2022; shortlisted.

quotes.race: Napoleons Casino Bradford Handicap
quotes.quote: Good ride wasn't it? It's alright having the idea but you've got to follow it through and Shane (Gray) didn't go too fast. When you go out on a limb it's easy to get the fractions wrong and he didn't do that. I think the only reason So Grateful won is because of the tactics we took on, so the handicapper should drop us for that! - David Easterby, joint-trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Kurimu
runners.comment: Not at best in two AW runs for new stable but is interesting returned to turf
runners.spotlight: Not at best in two AW runs this term for new stable; largely consistent form in turf handicaps includes sole success (off 1lb higher last June); interesting returned to this sphere.

runners.name: Lets Go Hugo
runners.comment: Has been shaping as if this step back up to 6f is worth exploring; possibilities
runners.spotlight: Record is 3-34; raced mainly at 5f but has been shaping as if this return to 6f is worth exploring; just 1-20 on turf but has possibilities off 5lb below last winning AW mark.

runners.name: Newyorkstateofmind
runners.comment: Best effort this season when second in small field at Hamilton two starts ago
runners.spotlight: Strike-rate is 9-82; best effort this season when second in small field at Hamilton on penultimate start; this is a deeper race but he remains well handicapped on peak form.

quotes.race: Read Katie Walsh On Betway Insider Handicap
quotes.quote: Newyorkstateofmind picked up for me in the straight, he's very honest and genuine. The gap opened up for us. He's been in great form lately - Ray Dawson.

stable_tour.quote: Three wins from 13 races last year was a nice return for this fellow, two on the all-weather and one on grass. Six of his nine wins have been on the all-weather and when it comes to the turf, he has to have theound fast. He was a bit disappointing when he returned to Wolverhampton from his winter break, but it is onwards and upwards. There's a race at Thirsk on Saturday that looks right for him. 09-04-25

runners.name: Masterclass
runners.breeder: Julia Scott, J F Dean, M L W Bell
runners.comment: Incurs 5lb penalty for Nottingham win but Grace Bell takes off 7lb; respected
runners.spotlight: Won by half a length at Nottingham (5f, good to firm) last week, taking record to 4-37; incurs 5lb penalty but Grace Bell takes off 7lb; effective over 6f in the past; respected.

quotes.race: At The Races App Form Study "Confined" Apprentice Handicap (For horses Which Have Not Won In 2023)
quotes.quote: The plan was to take a lead on Masterclass and he picked up nicely when I asked him. He liked the ground and has a good attitude - Brandon Wilkie, jockey.

runners.name: Monsieur Fantaisie

prev_owners.owner: Phil Hart And The Cross Racing Club

runners.comment: Five-time AW scorer; made the frame in most recent turf run; debut for new yard
runners.spotlight: Five-time AW scorer; 0-17 on turf but finished fourth in big field at Thirsk (6f) in most recent attempt in this sphere; frame possibilities on debut for new yard.

runners.name: Evoluir
runners.comment: Both wins on AW; possibly not crying out for this return to sprinting; opposed
runners.spotlight: Both wins on AW, latest over 7f in February; form dipped the last twice and possibly isn't crying out for this return to sprinting; not the percentage call.

runners.name: Endowed
runners.comment: Ran encouragingly last time but isn't certain to back up that effort
runners.spotlight: Record is 4-46, the most recent win in 2022; ran encouragingly under Imogen Mathias last time but isn't sure to back up that effort, having been inconsistent for current stable.

runners.name: Peachey Carnehan
runners.breeder: J M Duggan & The Late  T Duggan
runners.comment: Veteran who has weak claims on recent form
runners.spotlight: Veteran who is a 17-time winner but holds weak claims on recent form and needs to prove he can still be competitive aged 11.

quotes.race: Betway Heed Your Hunch Handicap
quotes.quote: They went a good pace which was good as if they'd dawdled I would have been in trouble as Peachey Carnehan missed the break - James Sullivan

quotes.race: Sri Lanka The Wonder Of Asia Handicap
quotes.quote: Peachey Carnehan was unlucky not to win last time and, with his rating, we had to run today. I've just freshened him up and he's been running well. That's three quick runs now so he'll have a break - Michael Mullineaux, trainer.

quotes.race: 32Red.com Maiden Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: Peachey Carnehan in good shape and improved a little bit from last week. That's his trip as a mile would stretch him - Adam Kirby, jockey.

4:55.race_name: Racing TV Profits Returned To Racing Handicap

runners.name: Gesundheit
runners.comment: 6f winner for Ed Walker; modest runs for this yard; may improve with a hood after wind op
runners.spotlight: Bought for 30,000gns last October after winning a 6f Kempton nursery for Ed Walker; subsequently gelded; hasn't shown much for present yard (pulled hard first run at 7f last time); should do better on first run back after wind surgery with a hood now tried.

runners.name: Bantz
runners.comment: Inconsistent; off the mark on turf at Doncaster latest; 4lb higher; should go well again
runners.spotlight: Not particularly consistent; off the mark on turf when winning over this trip at Doncaster last time (good to firm); should go well off this 4lb higher mark.

stable_tour.quote: He won and was placed on the all-weather at Newcastle over the winter and will be campaigned on the turf now over 7f. He wants top of the ground but he'll get that at the moment, so we'll probably see him out very soon. 23-04-25

runners.name: Eighteen Fourteen
runners.comment: 6f novice win here last June; disappointing since, including both runs this term
runners.spotlight: Won a 6f novice here in June last year (good to firm); that form looked sound enough but has been very disappointing since, including on both runs this year (1m/7f; cheekpieces tried last time) having been gelded in November; bit to prove.

runners.name: Spring Corn
runners.owner: S Bulmer, P Hebdon & R Taylor
runners.comment: Third twice as a 2yo (5f/6f); not progressed since handicapping; needs to improve for 7f
runners.spotlight: Finished third on a couple of occasions as a juvenile (5f/6f); hasn't progressed since going handicapping and improvement needed on his first try at 7f.

runners.name: Cushty
runners.owner: Formulated Polymer Products, Mrs R Carr
runners.comment: Close third in a 7f AW maiden last September; not progressed; needs to improve recent form
runners.spotlight: Best run when third in a 7f maiden at Newcastle in September; has been a bit disappointing since and needs to improve on her three runs this season.

stable_tour.quote: She a leggy filly, out of a mare who won four times, but she will fill out. She just needs time to mature. She's been running over 6f and 7f but will stay a mile soon. She's entered at Southwell on Tuesday over 7f. 09-04-25

runners.name: Tortoiseshell
runners.comment: Best run when third in AW maiden in January; should improve on handicap/turf debut; chance
runners.spotlight: Seemed to show improved form when third in a Newcastle fillies' maiden in January; had to run of the race that day, but further improvement expected on her handicap/turf debut; chance.

runners.name: Bermuda Princess
runners.comment: Modest form for William Haggas as a 2yo; no better for this yard in 2025; plenty to prove
runners.spotlight: Three modest efforts for William Haggas as a juvenile (first two on turf); didn't seem to stay 7f when sixth on handicap/stable debut but fared no better back at 6f last time; others stronger.

runners.name: I Can Boogy
runners.comment: Beat Perfidia by a neck over C&D last week; may not confirm the form on 6lb worse terms
runners.spotlight: Has won two of her last four races, a 1m Southwell handicap in April and over C&D last week when scoring by a neck in a blanket finish (good to firm; Perfidia second); penalised 6lb; each-way chance.

runners.name: Perfidia
runners.comment: Second to I Can Boogy over C&D last week but can reverse the placings on 6lb better terms
runners.spotlight: Maiden; runner-up on all three starts this season after being gelded, last week over C&D, getting caught close home and beaten a neck by I Can Boogy (now 6lb worse off); obvious contender.

runners.name: Due Respect
runners.comment: Showed bits of form for two previous trainers but well beaten on stable debut last week
runners.spotlight: Showed bits of form for Michael Butler in Ireland last season and for John Butler on the AW earlier this year; well beaten on stable debut at Carlisle last week (1m, good to firm; pulled hard); may do better back at 7f but others appeal more.

runners.name: Dopamine
runners.comment: Shaped as though worth stepping up in trip over 1m last time; could have a say
runners.spotlight: Landed a five-runner Southwell novice (7f, Tapeta) last October; out of the frame in both starts since, but she shaped as though worth stepping up in trip when sixth of eight on handicap debut at Yarmouth (1m, good to firm) this month; could have a say.

runners.name: Like Magic
runners.comment: Dual Flat winner in Germany, but poor over hurdles since joining this yard
runners.spotlight: Turf/sand winner on the Flat in Germany (1m/1m1f), but poor in three starts over hurdles since returning for this yard in February (underwent wind surgery before latest outing); enough to prove.

runners.name: Raintown
runners.owner: Ms Caroline Instone & J S Moore
runners.comment: Course winner, but well beaten in last two starts and is draw wide; cheekpieces on
runners.spotlight: Six of his seven wins have come on the Lingfield Polytrack (1m-1m4f), but the other one came here (8.6f); just 1lb above his last winning mark, but well held in his last two starts and isn't favoured by the draw; cheekpieces are now given a go.

stable_tour.quote: He won by five lengths at Lingfield and went up to a mark of 75. He still ran a nice enough race at Newbury but would probably need to be a bit lower-rated on the grass. He'll win plenty more but he seems to be more of an all-weather horse. He doesn't seem to transfer his all-weather form to grass. He'll be one to follow any time he's on the all-weather. He would still be ahead of the handicapper on that and there'd be a couple of very nice races for him on the all-weather. He's a very big horse and is getting stronger; he'll be a better type of horse with another six months on him. He's one of those late-maturing horses but he's won five races for us, which tells you the ability he's got. 04-07-24

runners.name: Star Pupil
runners.comment: Dual course winner, but well held in last two starts and has the outside stall.
runners.spotlight: Two of his three wins have come here, the latest (8.6f) in March; twice well held off a mark just 1lb higher than today in the meantime and the widest stall isn't ideal either.

runners.name: His Finest Hour
runners.comment: C&D winner last October; worth a market check on return from 166 days off
runners.spotlight: Improved from his belated debut when winning an uncompetitive novice over C&D last October, but well held on handicap debut at Chelmsford (1m2f, Polytrack) in December; off 166 days since, but it's still early days and the return here may help; worth monitoring in the market.

runners.name: Bearaway
runners.comment: C&D winner; should be suited by the return to this trip; O Murphy an eyecatching booking
runners.spotlight: Three wins for Simon Pearce during the winter, two at Lingfield (1m2f, Polytrack) and the other over this C&D; no show on debut for this trainer at Lingfield (1m4f) last month, but this sort of trip suits him better and Oisin Murphy is an eyecatching booking; interesting.

stable_tour.quote: After his only start last year he was lame and this season he started back at Southwell with an encouraging second and, yes you guessed it, he was lame again. His owner gave him to me last year due to this problem and the issue hasn't gone away but hopefully it'll improve with time. He's out in a field and will be back in the winter 04-08-21

runners.name: Revich
runners.comment: Very much on the downgrade, but Tom Marquand (1-2 on him) regains the ride; watch market
runners.spotlight: Smart handicapper for Richard Spencer (RPR 104), but very much on the downgrade and showed nothing on his stable debut/reappearance at Epsom (8.5f, good) five weeks ago; however, Tom Marquand (1-2 on him) regains the ride so interesting to see if there is any support for him.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Price Boosts Handicap
quotes.quote: I didn't really plan to be that far back, but I couldn't have gone much quicker. Revich clearly thrives on this track and this is his type of ground. He's a little terrier when he's under pressure and I got a really nice lead into it from Jason (Hart, jockey Titan Rock) and he took me to the winning line. I suppose they raced up the inside yesterday and it might be a bit chopped up on that rail. It's drying ground, it's fine - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: CAA Stellar Earl Grosvenor Handicap
quotes.quote: Revich doesn't know how to run a bad race but there's something about coming to Chester. He loves a bend, he likes it when it's soft and he was off his last winning mark so there were a lot of boxes ticked today. You need luck here and they did go plenty hard enough up front, to negate the fact that he didn't quite ping the lids as we'd have hoped. He got the gap at the right time but you still need the horse to go through it and he showed such a tenacious attitude to go through. Jim gave him a great ride, he didn't panic, he kept his head and the horse went through with it. We might look at a 70,000GBP handicap at Newbury next week to run in under a penalty because daylight was second and we may need to do something sharpish - Tim Palin, owner's racing manager.

quotes.race: #chestertogether Handicap
quotes.quote: The first-time visor has helped his confidence and he's quickened up nicely close home. We plotted this race up and he could potentially run back here in the 7.5f handicap on Thursday - Richard Spencer, trainer.

runners.name: Serious Look
runners.comment: 6lb higher in bid for a C&D hat-trick; hard to rule out in his current mood
runners.spotlight: Had dropped a long way in the weights prior to winning twice over C&D this spring (both wins under Robert Havlin), following a 188-day break; 6lb higher than last time in a much better race, but he has been rated much higher in the past and hard to rule out in his current mood.

runners.name: Saturnalia
runners.owner: Ms H N Pinniger And Partner
runners.comment: Losing run up to 19 and still to prove he wants this far; blinkers on
runners.spotlight: Went close a couple of times earlier in year including here (8.6f), but losing run up to 19 and still to prove he wants this far; first-time blinkers replace cheekpieces.

stable_tour.quote: Having gelded him last summer he never made his racecourse debut until Lingfield in January when second over a mile. The drop back to 7f did the trick as next time out he won at Wolverhampton. He has run well in defeat since, notably when a neck second at Kempton. His last three runs, all on turf, have not been great but he is a solid horse and I am hoping that he can put those efforts behind him back at Newbury on Tuesday. I am looking for a nice run from him this week, but it could be that we have him wrong and he is a sprinter. 29-06-23

runners.name: Molly Valentine
runners.comment: C&D winner; 6lb higher than for latest win and drawn wide, but still holds each-way claims
runners.spotlight: Patchy form of late, but she did manage to win over C&D in December and in first-time blinkers at Lingfield (1m2f, Polytrack) last month (a couple of subsequent winners behind); 6lb higher and drawn wider than ideal, but still holds each-way claims if near her best.

runners.name: Golspie
runners.comment: Placed in last three starts off this mark including twice runner-up over C&D; thereabouts
runners.spotlight: 0-17 since his successful debut, but placed in his last three starts off this mark including when twice runner-up over C&D in March; thereabouts; stable triple-handed.

stable_tour.quote: This colt made a winning start to his career when taking a mile maiden at Newbury, when I thought he had a good chance. Last time out I sent him to Newmarket for his handicap debut but the ground was too fast. When he won it was soft and we have learned that he must have plenty of give underfoot to be his best. I think he is on a nice mark (81) when the ground is right. 11-07-23

runners.name: Eden Storm
runners.comment: Losing run up to 14; effort over C&D 15 days ago was inconclusive as regards stamina
runners.spotlight: Both wins have come over 7f here; losing run up to 14 despite slipping down the weights and his effort over C&D 15 days ago was inconclusive as regards stamina.

runners.name: Wyvern
runners.owner: Pat Morris And Clear Cut Racing
runners.comment: Still 1lb below his last winning mark, but his stamina for this far remains to be proven
runners.spotlight: Placed in three of his last four starts, the latest when beaten less than a length in an amateur riders' event here (8.6f); still 1lb below his last winning mark, but his stamina for this far remains to be proven.

8:42.race_name: Play At The Races StableDuel Fillies' Handicap

runners.name: Spiced Rum
runners.comment: Well beaten in sole AW handicap; turf winner at 2m1f; off since April 2024; new yard
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in sole AW handicap but won on turf (2m1f, heavy) in late 2023 before winning twice over hurdles in spring 2024 for Stuart Kittow; not seen since that April, though, and betting can guide on yard debut.

runners.name: Sids Annie
runners.breeder: Miss A Gibson Fleming & Selwood B/Stock
runners.comment: Course winner; first past the post but demoted in February; lesser effort since
runners.spotlight: Course winner whose latest win came on turf at 1m4f in 2023; first past the post before demoted at Kempton in February but she didn't run to nearly the same level at Kempton in March and now has something to prove.

quotes.race: Lakeside Village Outlet Shopping Doncaster Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: I think on the back of her recent success, Sid's Annie has got a bit of confidence now. We could have done with a stronger gallop earlier on, but so could everyone - Dane O'Neill, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Encircle
runners.comment: Promising debut here for the Crisfords; well beaten in 2 runs for yard; handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Promising debut over the extended 1m1f here in January 2024 for the Crisfords; soundly beaten in two starts at 7f and 1m for this yard but her dam bred winners on the continent at 1m3f-1m6f so this trip could suit on handicap debut; new aids fitted.

runners.name: Kokinelli
runners.breeder: S C E A Marmaion Vauville & Alain Jathie
runners.comment: Not looked ahead of her mark but fair 3rd (1m4f) on AW in October; still time to do better
runners.spotlight: Not yet looked ahead of her mark on turf and AW but she wasn't far away when third of 12 finishers at Kempton (1m4f) in October; found wanting at Southwell later that month but still time for her to move forward.

runners.name: Damzon
runners.comment: Hint of ability in bumpers and on AW; down the field latest; handicaps more suitable
runners.spotlight: Signs of ability in bumpers this time last year; has raced in novice and maiden events over hurdles and on the AW since, showing more when fourth of five at Kempton last month; way back at Southwell since but fitting cheekpieces on handicap debut might be the making of her.

runners.name: Phaedra
runners.comment: Acts on Tapeta; won both turf starts since upped to 1m4f; third run in 6 days; big penalty
runners.spotlight: Seems to act on Tapeta; major improvement since upped in trip, overwhelming the opposition at Chepstow (1m4f) on Wednesday and winning quite readily at Windsor (extended 1m3f; also on good) on Saturday; big penalty to carry on third run in six days but very competitive if still on her game.

quotes.race: DragonBet Proud Sponsors Of Chepstow Racecourse Handicap
quotes.quote: Phaedra is very straightforward, so it just made sense to go forward and see what happened. As it turned out, I was in front, and nobody wanted to take me on - Sean Levey, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Tralee Girl
runners.comment: Acts on Tapeta; hard-fought win on handicap debut (about 1m3f); can progress further
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in both starts over shorter here as 2yo; made successful switch to turf on reappearance in a Catterick maiden and finally got the upper hand over three rivals on handicap debut at Windsor (both about 1m4f on good to firm); up 2lb and should continue to progress.

runners.name: Solar Pass
runners.comment: Emphatic winner over 1m in December; step up in trip can suit on pedigree; handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Came on plenty for debut when going down narrowly at Lingfield (1m) in December, where next-time winners were third and fourth; emphatic winner over that C&D in January and with her siblings having won at 1m2f and 1m4f for this yard, there's a good chance she'll improve again now handicapping.

runners.name: Pure Theory
runners.comment: Has shown promise at 1m on Polytrack; dropped out over C&D latest; handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Has shown promise over 1m on Polytrack but her lead was taken from her over 2f out over C&D this month and she soon gave way; others higher up the list now switched to a handicap.

runners.name: A La Louche
runners.comment: Friendless in the market again when down the field on handicap debut (1m); new trip
runners.spotlight: Ordinary form and friendless in the market when beating only one home on handicap debut at Kempton (1m) last week; some positives in pedigree for 1m4f and interesting to see if the market likes her better today.

7:12.race_name: Dine In The Wolverhampton Horizons Restaurant Fillies' Handicap

runners.name: The Feminine Urge
runners.comment: Dual turf winner including last time but three efforts on AW leave something to be desired
runners.spotlight: Dual turf winner, the latest at Windsor (5f, good to firm; three of those behind won their next starts) this month; only 2lb higher, but her three previous efforts on the AW leave something to be desired.

quotes.race: Like Racing TV On Facebook Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: I wasn't sure if we got up. I thought we had a great draw in stall one but it played against us. We were a few rows back further than I'd have liked and had to wait for a gap, but The Feminine Urge showed a good attitude when she got out - Callum Rodriguez, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Jeans Maite
runners.comment: Front-runner and dual C&D winner but not at her best since returning last November
runners.spotlight: Front-runner best known for Southwell exploits (five wins) but she has also won twice over C&D; still 7lb below her last winning mark but not at her best since returning last November and vulnerable to younger rivals.

runners.name: Bella Love
runners.comment: 0-9; held in both starts since returning for this yard last month; more needed
runners.spotlight: Placed in five of seven starts for Craig Lidster last year including a close third at Newcastle (5f, Tapeta) on sole AW outing but out of the frame in two turf starts since returning for this yard in April; more needed.

runners.name: Colors Of Freedom
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner last autumn; 4lb higher than for her last win but still high on the list
runners.spotlight: Handy sort; well beaten on turf at Lingfield last time but has never shown any aptitude for grass; 6-22 on AW, though, including two C&D wins last autumn; 4lb higher than for the latest but still high on the list.

quotes.race: talkSPORT Download The App Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Colours of Freedom has taken a little while to come to hand and I think that stiffer 6f has really played to her strengths. She's off a basement mark, so hopefully she can have a productive winter - Luke Morris, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Startling
runners.comment: C&D winner and a close third back here in her last two starts; cheekpieces on; respected
runners.spotlight: All three wins in AW nurseries late last year including one over C&D; running well in her last three starts having dropped back to her last winning mark, finishing a close third in the last two back here; should have the race run to suit and respected in first-time cheekpieces.

runners.name: Jake Loves Laura
runners.comment: 0-8; has shown ability including when third here last time; certainly worth a go over 5f
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden who ran her best race so far when beaten just over a length into third of 12 on stable debut here (6f) eight days ago; not short of speed so certainly worth a go over 5f; shortlisted.

runners.name: Hint Of Humour
runners.comment: 0-5 but has shown ability; market may indicate what is expected back from 138 days off
runners.spotlight: 0-5 but has shown ability, as when twice third on the Lingfield Polytrack (5f/6f) during the winter; market may indicate what is expected returning from 138 days off.

runners.name: Madame Fenella
runners.comment: Not in much form lately and a record of 2-32 doesn't inspire confidence
runners.spotlight: Hold-up performer who should get the strong pace she needs but not in much form lately and a record of 2-32 doesn't inspire confidence.

quotes.race: Raceday Afternoon Tea Sunday 9th July Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Madame Fenella always shapes as if she is going to get further but she's a proper six furlong horse. I might run her at Newmarket next Friday night under a penalty - Derek Shaw, trainer.

runners.name: Fabuleux Du Clos
runners.breeder: A Jollivet, C Lecomte & F Lecomte
runners.comment: Dual winning hurdler; well beaten in two AW novices and a hurdle since returning in March
runners.spotlight: Dual winning hurdler over 2m4f/3m in 2023, but well beaten in a 2m7f handicap hurdle and two Tapeta novices at around 1m4f since returning from 15 months off in March.

runners.name: Midnight Ravens
runners.comment: Well beaten on his return/stable debut at Kempton last month
runners.spotlight: Promise in two starts on Polytrack for Barry Brennan at the end of 2023 but well held in one turf run for Tom Dascombe last summer and (having been gelded) was well beaten on return/stable debut at Kempton in April.

runners.name: Thatsthewayitis
runners.comment: Faces a stiff task on belated debut
runners.spotlight: Closely related to 1m2f winner Debatable (RPR 80), half-brother to winners One Last Dance (8.6f AW 2yo; 77) and Isaiah (1m5f; 66); dam 1m2f AW winner (78), half-sister to French 1m4f Listed winner;  faces a stiff task on belated debut.

runners.name: King Al
runners.comment: Won his only start at Haydock last year; half-brother and dam are both Tapeta winners
runners.spotlight: Was 11-2 when narrowly making a winning debut at Haydock (1m, heavy) in September; the form of that race hasn't worked out but half-brother and dam are Tapeta winners so interesting to see what the market says on return.

runners.name: Cajole
runners.comment: Won at Newcastle this month (first two clear); probably capable of a good deal more
runners.spotlight: Made a promising debut when fourth of ten at Newbury (7f, good) last month and built on that when winning at Newcastle (1m, Tapeta) three weeks later (first two clear); her classy pedigree suggests she is probably capable of a good deal more; major player.

quotes.race: Roflow Memorial Race Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Cajole ran a good race first time out on firm ground and she was only going to come on for the run. She's bred for the trip and she learnt a lot from her last day. She really galloped through the line and she could potentially get further in the future - Benoit De La Sayette, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Breakdancer
runners.comment: Seventh on Chelmsford debut last November; gelded since; watch market on return
runners.spotlight: 185,000gns foal, 450,000gns yearling; sent off just 5-1 for his Chelmsford debut (7f, Polytrack) last November, but could only manage seventh of 12 (albeit surrounded by subsequent winners); gelded since and worth a market check on return, although he has an awkward draw.

runners.name: Criminal
runners.comment: In the frame in his first two starts, but not sure dropping in trip is ideal
runners.spotlight: Showed promise when in the frame over 1m2f at Kempton (Polytrack) and Chester (good) in his first two starts; not sure dropping in trip is ideal, though, and the outside stall is also of little help.

runners.name: Frank Stamper
runners.comment: Attractive pedigree but stable doesn't have many winning newcomers; market revealing
runners.spotlight: 150,000gns yearling, 250,000euros breeze-up 2yo; half-brother to four winners including Yafta (5.7f/6f including 2yo/Group 3; RPR 114); dam 5f/6f winner (including 2yo/Listed; 107), closely related to 5f Group 3 winner Swiss Spirit; attractive pedigree but stable doesn't have many winning newcomers; market should be revealing.

runners.name: Nahraan
runners.comment: Interesting to see how he fares in the market on debut, especially in relation to Cajole
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam 1m winner (including AW; RPR 92), half-sister to 5.5f/6f Group 3 winner Sajir, out of Group-placed 6f 2yo winner; interesting to see how he fares in the market, especially in relation to stablemate Cajole.

runners.name: National Park
runners.comment: Promise in both starts and beaen just a short head last time; high on list
runners.spotlight: Promising fourth of 13 behind the smart Cosmic Year on Kempton debut (7f, Polytrack) and beaten just a short head in a first-time tongue-tie (now removed) in a five-runner Newcastle maiden (7f, Tapeta; third has won since) next time; high on list.

runners.name: Raedwald
runners.comment: Seventh in both starts over 1m on turf; handicaps may be more his thing
runners.spotlight: Seventh in both starts over 1m on turf, hinting at ability on this month's Yarmouth return; half-brother to a winner around here, but handicaps may be more his thing and Time Turner looks the stable's main hope.

runners.name: Time Turner
runners.comment: Green in both starts on turf last August; gelded since and well worth a market check
runners.spotlight: Well held in two 7f turf starts in August, running green both times and the second outing was in a  Sandown maiden that worked out very well; returns from nine months off having been gelded; well worth a market check.

runners.name: Bevy
runners.comment: Well beaten in both starts on Polytrack; handicaps become an option after this
runners.spotlight: Huge prices and well beaten in both starts over 7f on Polytrack; handicaps become an option after this.

6:12.race_name: Free Tips Daily On attheraces.com Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Amakhala
runners.comment: Last of five on this month's Kempton debut; major improvement required
runners.spotlight: Sent off 80-1 and missed the break when last of five on this month's Kempton debut (5f, Polytrack), finishing 4l behind Red Savitar; major improvement required.

runners.name: Bone Marra
runners.comment: Already gelded but nice pedigree and stable has its share of winning 2yo newcomers
runners.spotlight: April foal by Starman; 24,000euros foal; £60,000 yearling; half-brother to four winners including Messidor (Graded stakes-placed 6f-1m including AW 2yo; RPR 105), Loom Large (1m2f including AW; 78) and Kehlani (1m; 75); dam unraced half-sister to 9.4f Group 3 winner Duchess Andorra; already gelded, but nicely bred and stable has its share of winning 2yo newcomers; holds an entry in the sales race at the York Ebor meeting; watch market.

runners.name: He Bangs The Drums
runners.owner: Middleham Park Racing Lxii & Partner I
runners.comment: Stable has a fine record with 2yos first time out; market strength would be significant
runners.spotlight: February foal by Bungle Inthejungle; 60,000gns 2yo this month; brother to Czech 7f 2yo winner Ebony Inthejungle, half-brother to 5f winner Irish Rumour (RPR 78); dam unraced half-sister to Group-placed 7f 2yo winner Return Of The Mak; stable has a fine record with 2yos first time out and market strength would be significant.

runners.name: Henrythenate
runners.comment: Last of six behind a smart sort on his Newmarket debut last month; outside stall not ideal
runners.spotlight: 33-1 when a well-beaten last of six behind a smart sort on his Newmarket debut (5f, good) last month, fading after showing early speed; open to improvement, but the outside stall is not ideal.

runners.name: Irish Fighter
runners.comment: Stable has few winning 2yos first time out; best watched
runners.spotlight: February foal by Profitable; 25,000euros yearling; dam unraced half-sister to winners Epicuris (1m2f 2yo Group 1), Indeed (smart 1m-1m2f) and Austere (US 1m 2yo Listed), out of Listed-placed 1m 2yo winner; stable not known for winning 2yos first time out and this one was 66-1 when withdrawn after upset in the stalls on intended Goodwood debut; best watched.

runners.name: Jungle Monarch
runners.comment: Plenty to like on pedigree; stable has a fine record with 2yos first time out; interesting
runners.spotlight: March foal by Bungle IntheJungle; 150,000gns yearling; brother to 5f/6f winner Sergeant Wilko (including 2yo/AW; RPR 101), half-brother to winners Coul Queen (7f including 2yo; 95) and Stately Home (1m including AW; 88); dam well held 7f-9.4f (49); stable has a fine record with 2yos first time out; interesting, especially if positive in the market.

runners.name: London Is Blue
runners.comment: Stable not noted for winning 2yo newcomers
runners.spotlight: March foal by Territories; 45,000gns yearling; half-brother to winners Carmarthen (6f AW; RPR 66) and Under The Sea (7f 2yo; 61); dam third 1m AW 2yo (71); holds entries in a couple of sales races later in the season, but stable not noted for winning 2yo newcomers.

runners.name: Red Savitar
runners.breeder: Hellwood Stud Farm & R C Dollar
runners.comment: Third of five in both starts on the AW; sets the standard, but not an insurmountable one
runners.spotlight: Nicely bred; tongue tied when finishing third of five in both starts over 5f on AW but he didn't build on last month's Southwell debut at Kempton next time; sets the standard but it's not an insurmountable one.

runners.name: Diamond Alexander
runners.owner: Dave Evans, Mrs C Derham & Partner

prev_owners.owner: Dave Evans, Mrs C Derham & Partner

runners.comment: Attractive pedigree but would be a rare winning 2yo newcomer for the yard
runners.spotlight: April foal by Cotai Glory; £100,000 yearling; sister to multiple 5f winner Democracy Dilemma (including 2yo/Listed), half-sister to five winners including Angel Alexander (Group-placed 5f/6f; 111) and Sky Majesty (6f 2yo including Group 2); dam Listed-placed 5f 2yo winner (91); holds entries in sales races later but would be a rare winning 2yo newcomer for yard.

8:12.race_name: Wolverhampton Family Fun Raceday 10th August Handicap

runners.name: Latin

prev_owners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith
Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith

runners.comment: 0-20 in Ireland but still looks very interesting on debut for James Owen
runners.spotlight: 0-20 when trained in Ireland (including one hurdle run) but starts off for James Owen on a workable mark and his new stable's very good record with new recruits makes him of strong interest.

runners.name: Naughty Niall
runners.comment: Narrow winner at Southwell in December but began this year with two lesser efforts
runners.spotlight: Held on well to open account at Southwell (1m) in December, his tenth start, but began this year with two lesser efforts and has fitness to prove after 99-day break.

runners.name: Back From Dubai
runners.comment: Placed four times since winning C&D classified in January; can make presence felt again
runners.spotlight: Has modest strike-rate in recent years but won C&D classified in January and has been placed on four of his seven starts since; current mark is workable; can make his presence felt.

quotes.race: Spreadex Sports Injury Time Loser Insurance Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Back From Dubai broke well and I just let him use his stride and he's toughed it out to the line - Jordan Williams, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Balqaa
runners.comment: Ran okay on turf last month and returns to Tapeta on a good mark; considered
runners.spotlight: Placed off higher marks on Tapeta during the winter and returns to her preferred surface after fairly respectable turf run last month; no surprise if she features.

stable_tour.quote: She runs in the well-known green silks of owner John Fretwell and has had three runs over a mile this summer. She needs more racing to come to herself as she has not shown too much so far. I do like her and in time she will win races. I may consider dropping her down to 7f at some point, yet she looks as if a mile should be her trip 23-09-21

runners.name: Bitacora
runners.comment: Won 8.6f classified here in March and may have more to offer over this longer trip
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish mare who came good for Daragh Bourke at third attempt, in 8.6f classified here in March; might have a bit more to offer for her new yard over this longer trip; high on the list.

runners.name: Cryptos Dream
runners.comment: Unlucky not to finish closer than fourth over C&D last time; now back on last winning mark
runners.spotlight: Placed at Chelmsford (1m2f) last month and was denied clear run in closing stages when fourth over C&D a few days later; now back on same mark as for C&D win in November; respected.

runners.name: Beaming Light
runners.owner: R G Robinson & R D Robinson
runners.comment: Absent since struggling on hurdle debut in November; now with new stable
runners.spotlight: 0-12 under all codes for Laura Horsfall and absent since struggling on hurdling debut in November; considered only if lively in the betting before this stable debut.

runners.name: Trusty Scout
runners.comment: Consistent 7yo; placed over C&D under enterprising ride a fortnight ago
runners.spotlight: Without a win since 2023 but scores good marks for his consistency; enterprising tactics did not pay dividends over C&D a fortnight ago but he still ran a big race before weakening into third; continues to edge down the weights and probably won't be far away.

runners.name: Sun Festival
runners.comment: Second in two C&D classified races at start of this year but has become unreliable
runners.spotlight: Second in two C&D classified races at start of this year but has become unreliable and is on a long losing run; others appeal more.

runners.name: Bandello
runners.comment: Not beaten far on any of three stable starts but needs to learn to settle better
runners.spotlight: 11-race maiden; not beaten far on any of three starts for new stable this year and remains very unexposed over this sort of trip but his tendency to race too freely remains a worry.

runners.name: Change Of Fortune
runners.comment: Safely held in two 8.6f handicaps here this spring and now 0-25
runners.spotlight: Safely held in two 8.6f handicaps here since returning from a break last month and now 0-25; will be suited by this move back up in trip but needs to raise his game.

runners.name: Aeroplane Mode
runners.comment: Had excuse when well beaten last time; claims if judged on earlier Lingfield third
runners.spotlight: Ran no race on latest outing, having boiled over in the preliminaries, and is now 0-14 but gave pretty good account when placed in 1m2f Lingfield classified two starts ago and is also suited by this C&D; could have a say if new headgear has positive effect.

runners.name: Dors Delight
runners.comment: 80-1 second over C&D last month but others have more persuasive profiles overall
runners.spotlight: Ten-race maiden; belied 80-1 odds when second over C&D last month and has now been placed on two of her last four appearances; however, others in this line-up nevertheless have more appealing profiles.

runners.name: Intervention
runners.breeder: D & S L Tanker Transport Ltd
runners.comment: Below his best at York last time and record now reads 1-33 on turf; others preferred.
runners.spotlight: Won at Lingfield in March (7f, AW) and followed that with two good efforts over shorter (5f/6f); had an excuse when slowly away at Chester but he was below his best at York (7f, good to firm) 11 days ago and record now reads 1-33 on turf; cheekpieces back on.

quotes.race: Win £2,000,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap
quotes.quote: It was a fantastic win again and Intervention is just an amazing horse. That's eleven wins since we bought him, his last four on the bounce. He's going on seven, in the form of his life and is better than ever. It secures at least sharing the top prize for the all-weather horse of the month at the Arc (Arena Racing Company) tracks in December because that's three wins from his last three runs. We're thrilled with him, he came to us as a longstanding maiden and Mick's just worked wonders with him. He's a bit of a hero of ours, he's won more races for us than any other horse and he's a firm favourite - Chris Dixon, syndicate boss.

stable_tour.quote: Our winningmost horse with 11 victories. He had quite a few goes before we bought him and he's won all those races for us and well over £100,000 in prize-money. He's just a legend. He runs his race nearly every time and always seems to be in the money. He's come down to a good mark again for the all-weather season and he's ready to win again soon. He's having a break now and usually thrives through the winter. 26-09-24

runners.name: Little Boy Blue
runners.comment: Won this race in 2022 off 3lb higher; off since September but he's proven fresh; claims.
runners.spotlight: Off since September but he's proven when fresh having won at Epsom (7f, good) off 1lb higher on his reappearance last July; has won here four times from nine starts, including this race in 2022 off 3lb higher and he holds sound claims on his return.

quotes.race: Marathonbet Festival Of Racing 7th-9th August Handicap
quotes.quote: Little Boy Blue took a fair hold on me early, and while I expected him to go well, I did not expect him to go that easily - Ryan While, jockey

quotes.race: 32Red.com / EBF Novice Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Little Boy Blue is a fast little horse with the a sprinter's back end on him. He can only keep improving - Luke Morris, jockey.

runners.name: Oj Lifestyle
runners.comment: Won twice here over a mile in blinkers last season; cheekpieces now on and claims if ready
runners.spotlight: Both wins last season came here over a mile in blinkers and he's been off since the latest of those in September off 6lb lower; drops back to 7f in a higher grade on his return with cheekpieces on; likely to go well if ready to go.

quotes.race: Make Your Best Bet At BetVictor EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: We expected better from OJ Lifestyle on his debut at Ascot and he was very disappointing, but he seems to have grown up since then. I'm so surprised by this win that I've had no thoughts about what we might do with him next - Gary Moore, trainer.

runners.name: Secret Strength
runners.comment: Can start slow but he wasn't beaten far in a lower grade at Chelmsford last time; claims.
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner who can be slowly away; made a winning stable debut at Lingfield (7f, AW) off 5lb lower in January and wasn't beaten far when fourth at Chelmsford (7f, AW) last time; up in grade now back on turf and this smaller field probably isn't ideal for him due to his hold-up style, but he holds place claims.

quotes.race: Win £1M With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: If you look back at Secret Strength's old form he was the best horse in the race if he could find that again. People latched on to the jockey booking too, but I said to David [Allan, rider] he was in great order and was fit as I could've had him - Shaun Lycett, trainer.

runners.name: Uncle Dick
runners.comment: Yet to win over 7f but he loves it here and has to be respected now 1lb below his last win
runners.spotlight: Seven-time course winner who is 1lb below the latest of those which came over a mile last August; finished sixth of ten after blowing the start at Kempton (1m, AW) 20 days ago and he's yet to win over 7f but has to come into consideration back here; blinkers (worn once before) replace cheekpieces.

quotes.race: Carlsberg Danish Pilsner Brighton Mile Challenge Handicap (For the Brighton Mile Challenge Trophy)
quotes.quote: Uncle Dick is an absolute legend. He's won for all my apprentices either this year or last and just loves it at Brighton, he's just a different horse there. He'll have to go again on Thursday. If I don't run him in that there's not another race he can run in at Brighton this year so we might as well give it a go. He's such a good horse to have and the Brighton Mile is an amazing race to win. He's usually winning 2,500GBP races so it's nice to win one worth four times more - Eve Johnson Houghton, trainer.

3:10.race_name: Star Sports We Believe In Bookmaking EBF Restricted Maiden Fillies' Stakes (Bands C/D) (Qual') (GBB)

runners.name: Diamond Peak
runners.comment: Out of a half-sister two Group/Grade 1 winners; wears a hood on debut, though
runners.spotlight: 22,000gns yearling; second foal; dam unraced half-sister to winners Without Parole (1m Group 1 St James's Palace Stakes) and Tamarkuz (US Grade 1 Breeders' Cup Dirt Mile); interesting pedigree, but it's unnerving to see a hood fitted on this debut outing.

runners.name: Echoofmymind
runners.comment: Recovered well from sluggish start to take very respectable fifth of 13 on Doncaster debut
runners.spotlight: Out of a 6f Group 3 winner; recovered well from slow start to take very respectable fifth of 13 on recent debut at Doncaster (5f, good to firm); upped in trip here; no surprise if she displays the necessary improvement.

runners.name: Senorita Vega
runners.comment: Commendable third from stall 11 in valuable Chester maiden this month; good chance here
runners.spotlight: Built upon her encouraging debut when keeping on for commendable third from stall 11 in valuable maiden at Chester's May meeting (5.5f, good); ought to be suited by the slightly longer trip here; good chance.

runners.name: Storm Flag
runners.comment: No serious threat at Ascot this month but her debut in April was quite promising
runners.spotlight: Unable to land a telling blow in good-quality Ascot maiden 18 days ago but will find this race easier and still has plenty of scope to progress from last month's encouraging debut at Newmarket (5f, good to soft).

runners.name: Jane Of The Jungle
runners.comment: Out of half-sister to Nunthorpe runner-up Que Amoro; has fairly good standard to reach
runners.spotlight: 17,000gns yearling; second foal; dam runner-up over 1m (RPR 68), half-sister to 5f Listed winner/Nunthorpe runner-up Que Amoro; has fairly good standard to reach on debut.

runners.name: My Sarah Bear
runners.comment: Half-sister to a French/Spanish 5.5f-7f 2yo winner; makes her debut here
runners.spotlight: 15,000gns yearling; second foal; half-sister to a French/Spanish 5.5f-7f 2yo winner; dam unraced half-sister to winners Azmeel (1m2f Group 3) and Baisse (German 1m Listed); entitled to learn from this debut outing.

runners.name: Rejjien
runners.owner: Mrs T Burns & Mrs S Loughnane
runners.comment: Last of nine when 14-1 for last month's debut at Bath (5f); needs to take big step forward
runners.spotlight: First foal from a useful 6f winner; last of nine when 14-1 for last month's debut at Bath (5f, good to firm); needs to take a big step forward over the longer trip here.

runners.name: Sparkling Pink
runners.comment: Showed only minor promise when sixth on Tapeta last month; moves up from 5f today
runners.spotlight: Out of a fair 6f 2yo winner; showed only minor promise when sixth at Southwell (5f, AW) last month and is not the most obvious answer here.

runners.name: Spirit Star
runners.comment: Ran on well for modest fourth on debut (5f, AW); ought to be more streetwise here
runners.spotlight: Outpaced in early stages before running on to take modest fourth at Wolverhampton (5f, AW) a fortnight ago; ought to be more streetwise here and the extra furlong is a likely plus but others have more pressing claims.

3:40.race_name: Download The Star Sports App 'Confined' Handicap (Have Not Won A Race Since 2024 Flat Turf Season)

runners.name: Dubawi Time
runners.owner: R Greenwood & John And Peter Seabrook
runners.comment: Ended last season with a soft-ground win but recent reappearance run was disappointing
runners.spotlight: Ended last season with a soft-ground win at Yarmouth and will be fine on the quicker surface here but dropped out of contention very tamely when back in action this month and needs that outing to have brought him on.

runners.name: Platinum Prince
runners.comment: As good as ever last summer/autumn; returns from break on fairly tough mark, though
runners.spotlight: Runs this track well and looked as good as ever last summer/autumn but returns from 202-day absence on fairly tough mark and would appeal more on slower than good ground.

runners.name: Imperial Cult
runners.comment: Yet to hit top gear after two runs this year but will appreciate this slight ease in grade
runners.spotlight: Yet to hit top gear after two AW starts this year but didn't run badly on the latter occasion; switches back to turf on a workable mark and is used to running in slightly better races than this now; respected.

runners.name: Joycean Way
runners.owner: J Harley, T Jacobs, G Moore

prev_owners.owner: Teme Valley, J Harley, T Jacobs, G Moore

runners.comment: Soundly beaten in all three handicaps for new stable this year; cheekpieces tried today
runners.spotlight: Placed in 7f AW maiden for Roger Varian in 2023; misssed his 3yo season and has has been soundly beaten in three handicaps for new stable this year (1m-1m2f; blinkered on second occasion) but is still worth keeping an eye on in the betting; cheekpieces tried today.

runners.name: English Spirit
runners.comment: Has done all his winning on AW; recent turf efforts don't inspire much confidence
runners.spotlight: Five-time winner on AW at Wolverhampton but 0-16 on turf; given a chance by the handicapper on this surface but recent efforts don't inspire much confidence, and today's trip may stretch him.

runners.name: Aikhal

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Mary Slack And Mrs J Slack Jell

runners.comment: Ran quite well a fortnight ago (9.4f) but wasn't in same form on Wednesday (1m4f)
runners.spotlight: Suggested he might be able to exploit his much reduced mark soon when fourth at Wolverhampton (9.4f) a fortnight ago but his run at Kempton (1m4f) on Wednesday was a backward step and he remains without a win since his Irish Group 3 success in June 2022.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Aikhal had the pace to get a proper position and he handles a dig. He will need to improve but he probably will - Seamie Heffernan, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He went to France last year and wasn't beaten far in a Group 1 race, so we were thinking he might be one to go the St Mark's Basilica route, the Poulains and the Prix du Jockey Club. He has worked very well. We think he's potentially a Classic-standard colt anyway, so the Irish 2,000 Guineas would be a possibility too. The Tetrarch Stakes has gone up to a mile from seven furlongs this year, so that could be a starting-off point for him. 19-04-22

runners.name: Twilight Guest
runners.breeder: Dullingham Park Stud & Mystic Mares Ltd
runners.comment: 0-28 overall but comes here after two pretty good efforts at Yarmouth
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden after 28 starts but stuck to his task pretty well when placed in two 1m2f Yarmouth handicaps (both good to firm) this month; effectively 3lb lower than last time here and good 3lb claimer Jack Doughty is enlisted; likely contender.

2:40.race_name: Star Sports Brighton Owners Series Apprentice Handicap

runners.name: Danehill Star
runners.comment: 2-2 since the visor was applied; drops back in trip on a sharp track and unproven on turf
runners.spotlight: Four-time AW winner under Jack Doughty this year and made it 2-2 in the visor when winning at Wolverhampton (9.5f, AW) off 6lb lower 36 days ago; has to prove his effectiveness on turf (0-3) but holds claims if coping with the drop back to a mile on this sharp track.

runners.name: Roscioli
runners.comment: Off since failing to beat a rival home at Kempton in February; needs to bounce back.
runners.spotlight: Won twice last year (both off 1lb lower) but he's regressed in each of his three starts this year and has been off since failing to beat a rival home at Kempton (AW) in February; needs to bounce back returned to turf following a break.

runners.name: Spanish Mane
runners.comment: Well beaten in both starts since going close on her reappearance; needs to return to form
runners.spotlight: Dual course winner in 2022; went close on her reappearance at Yarmouth (7f, good) but she's been well beaten in both starts since; steps back up to a mile with a return to form needed.

runners.name: Brinton
runners.comment: Won two classified events on AW; respectable effort last time and now returns to turf
runners.spotlight: Won two classified events on AW in February/March and finished runner-up in handicap company off 1lb lower in April; posted a respectable effort at Wolverhampton (8.5f) earlier in the month and holds sound claims returned to turf.

runners.name: Monks Mead
runners.comment: Well beaten in three starts this year, including over 1m2f last time; more needed.
runners.spotlight: Has dropped in the weights following a series of below-par runs and the step up to 1m2f failed to spark a revival last time; drops back to a mile with more needed.

quotes.race: At The Races App Market Movers Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Monks Mead was very green at Windsor and Chelmsford, and then just ran in what looks like a good race at Newbury. I thought Ollie (Searle) gave him an excellent ride. I must say I was surprised the odds were so big because it's not a massive surprise he has shown some ability today - Mark Usher, trainer.

runners.name: Oh So Audacious
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner; didn't run badly at Yarmouth last time and she's respected back here
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner, with the latest coming off this mark last June before finishing in the first three in each of her final four outings last season; yet to feature in two starts this year but she didn't run badly at Yarmouth (1m, good to firm) 13 days ago; respected back here.

quotes.race: St Leger Form Study On attheraces.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Oh So Audacious isn't that quick but she tries very hard and I think if you get after her early enough she just keeps rolling - Hayley Turner, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Senseofentitlement
runners.owner: Miss M P Bryant, David & Eileen Bryant
runners.comment: Struggled in five starts for this yard; needs the cheekpieces to make a difference.
runners.spotlight: Sole win came at Wolverhampton in 2023 when trained by David O'Meara; needs the cheekpieces to make a difference with little to recommend him on since joining this yard.

5:15.race_name: 'Real Johnny G' Gallagher Birthday Handicap (Brighton Summer Sprint Series Qualifier)

runners.name: Arlecchinos Gift
runners.comment: Beat only one rival at Kempton when last seen; needs to bounce back returned to turf.
runners.spotlight: Made all at Kempton (6f, AW) off 1lb lower in February before finishing third of eight at Wolverhampton on his next start; below form at Kempton when last seen 62 days ago and needs to bounce back on return to turf.

quotes.race: Read Kevin Blake On attheraces.com Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: That was a good performance from Arlecchino's Gift. They went off quick enough which helped at the end and that was nice as most of his best form until now was on the all-weather. That drop of rain we had last night helped - Dane O'Neill, rider.

runners.name: Rebel Star
runners.comment: Consistent filly who won at Yarmouth last month; likely to give her running once again.
runners.spotlight: Gained her breakthrough success at Yarmouth (5f, good to firm) last month off 4lb lower and has backed that up with two solid third place finishes, most recently on turf at Nottingham (5f, good); consistent sort who is likely to give her running once again.

runners.name: Call Time
runners.owner: The 19Th Hole Syndicate & J S Moore
runners.comment: Sole win came on soft and he was beaten 30l on reappearance; down in grade.
runners.spotlight: Sole win came in a soft-ground novice at Bath (5f) in October; beaten 30l when last of 17 at Haydock (6f, good) on his return and now drops in grade; others preferred.

stable_tour.quote: He was second at Bath the other day. He could end up being a little bit ground dependent. You wouldn't probably run him on anything with firm in it but he'll be a horse who'll make a name for himself as the year goes on. There's plenty more to come from him on ground with a bit of juice in it over six or seven furlongs. 04-07-24

runners.name: Pop Dancer

prev_owners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd

runners.comment: Made all to win at Goodwood before finishing runner-up over C&D last time; contender
runners.spotlight: Made all to beat four rivals at Goodwood (5f, good; runner-up and third have won since) this month and he was only caught late on off this mark over C&D (hung left) last time; contender.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: We thought Pop Dancer would win first time and it was just greenness that beat him. He did it well today - assistant trainer Robin O'Ryan.

runners.name: Under Curfew
runners.comment: Never involved over 7f after an awkward start here last time; visor returns.
runners.spotlight: 9yo whose most recent win came at Wolverhampton (6f, AW) in February; wasn't at his best following an awkward start over 7f here six days ago but he's yet to win over that far and he isn't without a chance now dropping back in distance with the visor back on; stablemate of Pop Dancer.

quotes.race: Best Free Tips At valuerater.co.uk Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Under Curfew travelled beautifully. I was told to follow our other horse [Bezzas Lad] but he went off too quick. We slotted in and he couldn't try any more for me ? I couldn't stop screaming from two out - Mollie Phillips, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He won at Bath in May and then again at Salisbury last month.  He was second at Bath last Friday night - it looked an easy opportunity for him with just three runners, but they're never easy and 5f on very fast ground probably just caught him out - he's more a 6f horse really. The winner of the race is possibly all right. He'll run in the Bullet at Brighton on Friday. All ground comes alike to him and he's in good form. 07-08-24

runners.name: Mary Of Modena
runners.comment: Needs to take a big step forward from her recent return to action following wind surgery
runners.spotlight: Now 11lb below her latest win which came at Newmarket (5f, soft) in August 2023; failed to beat a rival over C&D on her return six days ago on first start since undergoing wind surgery; needs to take a big step forward to reverse form with Pop Dancer.

quotes.race: Read Kevin Blake On attheraces.com Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: I thought I'd got beat to be honest as this six furlongs is a as far as Mary Of Modena wants to go on this ground. Ideally she wants five furlongs on soft - William Carson, jockey

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Handicap
quotes.quote: Mary Of Modena likes a bit of cut in the ground. She was temperamental and still is, but she's capable and probably five furlongs is her limit. She hopefully won't go up much for this so perhaps we can find a similar 0-60 for her and, with a bit of juice in the ground, there's no reason she can't win again - Michael Attwater, trainer.

runners.name: Dream By Day
runners.comment: On a good mark but he hasn't won since 2023; returns to turf with the hood back on.
runners.spotlight: 3-25; most recent win came off 16lb higher at Goodwood (5f, good) in August 2023; pulled hard at Chelmsford (5f, AW) when last seen in February; refused to enter stalls in March and returns to turf with hood reapplied.

quotes.race: Racing TV Extra Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Dream By Day was a bit disappointing on his stable debut but made his way nicely into this. He travelled so well and picked up on the ground before idling late on. He's quite lightly raced and will get better with racing - Andrea Atzeni, jockey.

runners.name: Mr Ubiquitous
runners.comment: Followed Windsor win with one over C&D six days ago; leading contender under penalty.
runners.spotlight: Won at Windsor (1m, good to firm) last month and followed up over this C&D (good) six days ago; bids to complete the hat-trick under a penalty with Kaiya Fraser taking off 3lb and he's a leading contender.

runners.name: Equalised
runners.comment: Best efforts at 6f on AW and he faded when upped to 7f at Lingfield (turf) last time.
runners.spotlight: Best efforts from six starts have been over 6f on AW; looked to be worth a try over 7f when third at Kempton (AW) in April but he faded when upped to this trip at Lingfield last time (good to firm); dropped 3lb.

stable_tour.quote: The form of his first two races is strong but he wants better ground than he's had the last twice. He broke slowly from a terrible draw at Chester last time and you can put a line through that. He's rated 71 and should be competitive off that. He could go to Goodwood on Friday. 02-08-24

runners.name: Red Admiral
runners.comment: Well beaten on handicap debut at Bath (1m) last time; since been purchased for 4,600gns.
runners.spotlight: 0-4; fifth of 12 at Wolverhampton on debut for George Boughey and was well beaten at Bath (1m, good to firm; made the running) on handicap debut 37 days ago; drops back to 7f on his debut for another new yard having been purchased for 4,600gns; watch the market.

runners.name: Rage Of Thunder
runners.comment: Solid effort at Kempton on his return; will need to settle back over this extra furlong.
runners.spotlight: 0-8; returned from a 107-day absence with a solid fourth of 11 under Ashley Lewis at Kempton (6f, AW) following a slow start; should come on for that but he has raced freely and will need to settle now stepping back up in trip returned to turf.

runners.name: Princess Qajar
runners.comment: Failed to build on her debut effort last year; drops to 7f on handicap/turf debut.
runners.spotlight: Fourth of nine on her debut at Wolverhampton (8.5f, AW) in October but she was too free in her next two starts (8.5f/1m); the drop to 7f may suit in that regard and she's open to improvement on turf debut now switching to handicap company after 174 days off; watch the betting.

runners.name: Lady Kilonova
runners.comment: Looked a bit awkward in the straight when third last time and cheekpieces now tried.
runners.spotlight: Beat only one rival home on handicap debut at Wolverhampton (8.5f, AW) in October but posted a more encouraging effort back there when third of 11 over 7f after 213 days off, although she did look a bit of an awkward ride in the straight; cheekpieces now applied on second start on turf.

runners.name: Callout
runners.comment: Runner-up over C&D behind Mr Ubiquitous six days ago; should be thereabouts.
runners.spotlight: 0-7 but he stepped forward from his stable debut when runner-up behind Mr Ubiquitous over C&D (good) six days ago; now 6lb better off with that rival and should be thereabouts.

runners.name: Makes Me Wonder
runners.comment: Made a winning turf debut over 1m at Yarmouth off 4lb lower; returns to 7f; contender.
runners.spotlight: Had some modest AW form but made a winning switch to turf under Taryn Langley at Yarmouth (1m, good) 35 days ago, beating one who won his next four starts; returns to 7f off 4lb higher and he should have more to come; contender.
